Échate faroles cuando puedas con las cartas de tu mano, se retorcido y despiadado, ¡esa es la clave de un auténtico capo!

179607.description:
A box set of four Zombicide: Black Plague survivors that were designed by Paolo Parente. These four survivor's are from his Anastyr fantasy world. The survivors include:
Undraal, Queen of the North
Skoll, the Protector
Konrad, Master of Blades
Arbwal, Maiden of War

Anastyr: In the days between the fall of Atlantis and the great Flood that would cover the entire world, conflict brews in the lust jungles and steaming swamps that someday would be the Mediterranean Sea.
Six great tribes of dragons have settled in this fertile valley, each ruling a kingdom of mortal followers. Inevitably, tensions rise between them as they plot for control of the world.
From the North, the humans worship the might Red Dragon who sleeps in the heart of a Great Volcano. To the South, in the deepest parts of the Undermountain, Anastyr - the Queen of All Black Dragons - lies brooding. This is their time, a time of Legend and Raw Magic Powers, a time of epic adventure: When the Dragons of Anastyr rule the Earth!
179607.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Paolo Parente

179608.name: D&D Adventures II
179608.description:
User summary

Supplement produced by the Italian magazine Anonima Gidierre.
This monographic product collects three D&D adventures using a generic setting.

179609.name: Five Count: Death Becomes You
179609.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first of our supplements for the 5th edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game. This volume's theme is undeath. You get 1 New Race, 2 New Creatures, 3 Class Options, 4 New Magic Items, and 5 New Spells! Plus hooks and ideas for your campaign throughout.

179610.name: Five Count: Hearts of Ice
179610.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this installment of Five Count we look at the lands of Ice with 1 new god (Ithaqua for you HPL fans), 2 Villainous Class Options, 3 Player Races, 4 icy spells, and 5 new items.

179611.name: A Deadly Catch
179611.description:
From publisher blurb:

Step closer little foals and pay heed to my tale, for it is a tale of fear and terror.

I'll tell you of a time back when the world was new and the Seahorses ruled beneath the waves. The time when Strynxgarnath, the Dweller Beneath, ripped a hole in the world and her Brood Mothers poured through the breach.

I’ll tell you of the ancient cities glimmering on the sea bed, that now lie dark and twisted. Cities that are now home to terrors not fit for young foals to know.

"A Deadly Catch" is a standalone adventure for 3 to 6 first level adventurers set in the world of Everglow. The action is set in a small fishing village and introduces a new and fearsome enemy rising from beneath the waves.

179612.name: The Spellsword: A Dungeon World Playbook
179612.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic has many forms and many purposes, but only one such purpose suits you needs - the hunt. A mercenary, trained in sword and magic, you are the perfect hunter. Nothing can get in your way. Nothing can stop you. Nothing, but a high price. You sell your sword and you sell your spells, and your demands will always be met. You are the Spellsword, and your price is high.

The Spellsword is a playbook for the Dungeon World roleplaying game. She is a warrior whose weapon of power grants her access to several mighty spells and abilities. The Spellsword playbook will allow you to play a character like Luke Skywalker, Thor, or Jean Pierre Polnareff in your Dungeon World game. You are the Spellsword, and your power is unmatched.

179614.description:
publisher blurb

"Every survivor knows that when facing zombies, preparation can be the difference between life and death. Be prepared! The Zombicide Storage Boxes are the perfect choice to keep your favorite Survivor ID Cards, Equipment deck, Zombie deck, dice and experience trackers all in one place and ready at a moment’s notice. Being prepared means more action!"

Each Zombicide Storage Box can hold:
- Up to 50 Survivor ID Cards.
- An Equipment deck and a Zombie deck, sleeved or not.
- Dice and experience trackers.

Zombicide Storage Boxes come in three colors: Blue, Green and Red.

admin comment
we do not normally approve storage solutions
this entry was approved because it's an official publisher product
179614.name: Zombicide: Storage Box

179615.description:
In just a few years, the world will be plunged into turmoil. Countries around the world will panic, widespread chaos will ensue, and civilized society will change virtually overnight as citizens cope with the loss of a modern-day vital resource. A resource needed for commerce. A resource needed for communication. A resource needed for life-sustaining technology. A resource needed for even simple comfort. The resource… is energy.

But that time is not here yet! Thankfully, you and a handful of other enterprising individuals have seen the writing on the wall, and you know it is up to you to save the world from the upcoming energy crisis! Of course, the recent United Nations Contract request for a global energy provider worth BILLIONS of dollars doesn’t hurt, either…

Compete with other players to win the contract and ensure that your company will become the #1 global energy power for decades to come! Obtain government industry permits by using energy credits allotted by the United Nations Council for aligning yourself to their objectives. Industries you own constantly increase the energy credits you are allotted, but they also increase the terawatt-hours (energy) generated by your company! And it is ultimately out-performing your opponents in this area and hitting the optimal level of terawatt-hours that will win you the U.N. contract, and win you the game!


Each player must make optimum use of their resources and the available hexagonal areas on the board to not only achieve a victory with generating enough terawatt-hours (TWh), but must also generate more TWh than their fellow players. In every round of play, each player will take a single turn. During this turn, you will draw a card, be “paid” in energy credits, allowed to roll the territory die, and either permit industries or take an investment beforehand. If you ever wish to end your turn early, you may draw another grid card. This will end your turn without taking further action. Your choices in actions determine your odds of victory here!

When drawing a grid card, keep it secret, as it can be your secret weapon against your fellow players! Place them face-down in front of you to play later, or play them immediately.

Because you get paid every turn, try to maximize your energy credit return early on in the game so that you can permit multiple, higher TWh industries quicker by amassing enough energy credits. Of course, as you’ll see when you play the game, this plan can be easier said than done!

For an added twist, each player has a unique and special ability with which they can use during the course of the game. This ability is granted by the Captain of Industry card each player selected at the beginning of the game. Use your ability to your advantage and out-maneuver your opponents! Only one player can win the United Nations Contract!

And if you optionally play with the countdown die, you’ll not only be racing other players, but racing time as well… This also makes solo play possible!

When a player reaches the TWh threshold, the current round of play is finished, and the player generating the most TWh wins Game of Energy!
179615.name: Game of Energy
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 107 - Samurai Spirit

179616.name: Planeteer
179616.description:
Planeteer is a unique dice allocation and tile laying game set in a retro science fiction universe. Each player takes on the role of a freelance space exploration agency. Throughout the game they will be hiring personel (known as Planeteers), exploring planetoids, encountering aliens, and completing objectives based on scenarios.

The game begins by drawing a random 4"x4" starting tile. This tile will set the scenario for the current game, whether it be a crashed starship of colonists that need rescuing, an alien hive that must be destroyed, or a cache of rare space minerals that can be mined and exploited. Players will then take turns laying down tiles to create a 5x5 grid that will serves as the planet's surface.

The game is divided into two phases: The Preparation Phase, and the Action Phase. During the Prep Phase, players will allocate dice to different tasks, such as acquiring components to build rovers to explore the planet surface, building and deploying rovers, researching technology, or recruiting more Planeteers (represented by 6-sided dice). Players have a maximum number of Planeteer Interaction Points (or pips) that can be allocated amongst their available Planeteers. Once players have taken their actions in the Prep Phase, any remaining Planeteers go to the Flight Deck, and will become the Pilots for the rovers during the Action Phase.

During the Action Phase, players will assign their Pilots to any rovers they have on the planet's surface. These vehicles can perform tasks such as moving around the planet, interacting with objects (like salvaging or mining for minerals), or attacking (other players or aliens). Each scenario has a certain objective to complete, and the player who does so most efficiently wins the game.

One of the most unique aspects of Planeteer are the rovers. Rovers are built by stacking components (cardboard chits). Each stack has a hole in the middle to fit a die (the pilot). The die face will show how many actions are available for that rover. Actions are dependent on the components equipped. Each component stacks so that it's available actions (icons) don't overlap, so any icon showing is an action available for that rover.

179617.name: Mythic Paths of the Lost Spheres: Godhunter
179617.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not ready for all 10 paths from Mythic Paths of the Lost Spheres? You might want to try out Godhunter first if you are looking to have your character rage against the Heavens themselves! Madmen. Heretics of the most extreme blasphemy. Enemies of the Gods themselves. Demigods spurned by their own parents. Opportunistic leeches of the limitless power of the Divinities. A lot of things can drive a character to the Path of the Godhunter.

These enemies of the divine are often the result of stories of tragedy that would shatter lesser beings but instead the Godhunter learns to break the divine powers that oppose them.

179618.name: Agents of the Miniverse (ICONS)
179618.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Agent of the Miniverse are 3 ruthless warriors who have joined the ranks of Krux Morta is his quest to bring ultimate entropy to the universe.

Cerabelax - A powerful psychic that specializes in mentally subjugating others into his personal army.
Raybex - Airborne scout and surgical striker who leads squads of his Raptovors into battle
Sectolon - Insectoid invader who mutates his unwary enemies into mind-controlled swarms of bug-men.




These three villains are ready for immediate action in your Cosmic ICONS game

179619.name: Shadow, Sword & Spell: Magic
179619.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is steeped in magic.

It is everywhere, inhabits everything, and fuels the desires of many.

Shadow, Sword & Spell: Magic is your guide to magic. Not only will you discover new spells and new alchemical arts, but also new options to add to your games. What options?

New skills
Rules on ether pools and ley lines
New magical options such as counter spelling and blood magic
Domain magic: Magic that allows you to harness the inherent magic that flows through the land and effects the entire domain
Rune magic: A long forgotten art that channels ether through inscribed runes
Rules for the creation of random items of magical power




Pick what you want, ignore what you don’t like, or use it all. Shadow, Sword & Spell: Magic is designed to enhance your magical game.

179620.name: The Holy MacGuffin
179620.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing Drop-In Dungeons! This series of releases will feature small adventures and dungeons, generally 5 pages or less, that are effortlessly inserted into almost any campaign for the times you players zig instead of zag and you find yourself unprepared. With the loose and opened ended way Drop-In Dungeons are written, you (the GM) can bait the hook however you want; the appetizers and desssert are up to you, herein you'll find the meat and potatoes.

The Holy MacGuffin: The sword of Toby MacGuffin, a local folk hero of yore, has been stolen from its resting place at a a local temple by a troll named Groth. Intended for a tier 2 group.

179621.name: Henolfetta
179621.description:
The players have to move their playing pieces (1 hat, 8 hatstones, 4 cones) into the starting positions of their opponent and back again to their own starting positions.

The hats move 1 space along their predrawn path.
The hatstones move 1 space straight in any direction.
The cones move any spaces diagonaly in any direction.
Hatstones and cones may jump diagonaly over an opponent hatstone any number of spaces away.




If an opponent hatstone blocks the movement of a hat, the player may roll a die. On the roll of a

1 or 6 the hat jumps on top of the hatstone,
2 or 4 the hat jumps over the hatstone and, if applicable, on top of a second headstone,
3 or 5 the hat has to use the detour (dashed line), if one branches off from the space it occupies.

179622.description:
Kingdom Builder: Marshlands, the third boxed expansion for Kingdom Builder designed by Donald X. Vaccarino, builds on this already exciting world of skill acquisition and land dominance.

There are 24 location tiles with 8 new abilities and 12 summary cards for the edges of the board. There are 4 new board quadrants with the Marshes land type on them. Castles have been replaced with Forts adding a different scoring possibility. To go along with this new land type, 5 Marsh terrain cards are added to the terrain deck.

What makes the Marshes expansion unique are the bonus abilities. For the included new abilities, a bonus ability is unlocked if you manage to collect that ability twice. For example, if you have collected the Rider ability, you may move one of your pieces into an adjacent land hex. If you collect a second Rider, then in addition to getting to move twice via your Riders, you can also jump one piece in a straight line to the first empty land hex.
179622.name: Kingdom Builder: Marshlands
boardgamepodcastepisode: Theme! Episode 24

179623.name: Acrohelion Campaign Setting
179623.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Acrohelion Campaign Setting is an exciting new game world for the popular D20 system. A dynamic blend of storytelling and action, rich backgrounds and high-quality game rules, this campaign setting provides a vast world for heroes to explore, shape, and conquer.
Highlights of this fully-illustrated, 284-page book include:


Six new player character races with full statistical information, detailed cultural and role-playing notes, and innovative concepts. Not just 'humans in strange costumes' -- unique creatures to stimulate your imagination!
Detailed, unique world background, with dozens of fascinating nations and cultures, both human and inhuman -- from the paladin-realm of Aesios to the nightmare despotism of the Black Summoners, from the mysterious and perilous realms of the elves to the harsh honor-bound society of the insectoid Quaishi, and many more.
A rich, distinctive mood and flavor to enhance your role-playing experience. Medieval fantasy at its best!
Inspiration for thousands of unique adventures in a dynamic, evolving world -- complete with its own approach to magic, its own ancient secrets and new conflicts. Provides flexibility and inspiration to both gamemasters and players. Filled to bursting with ideas that can be used in many different ways to make memorable quests!
Supports many different styles of play -- heroic, gritty, horror, action-oriented, puzzle-solving, etc. Designed to provide a mix of realism and heroism, action and deep role-playing.
Truly strange and deadly villains provide ample challenges for heroes to overcome.
Dozens of new spells and feats, many of them OGL.
14 perilous new monsters to challenge your heroes -- with full statistics expertly crafted to the highest standards, detailed ecological notes to inspire mini-adventure possibilities focusing on these creatures, and illustrations of most new monsters. From the tiny but deadly Brem, which is used as a living weapon by the nobles of Vervenao, to the ponderous constructs known as battle-spores, to the alien Aesilians who use their own bodies to create a living fortress, many new and unusual beasts await.
Two new 20-level character classes -- the Black Summoner of Insarc and the Solar Peer of Aesios -- and four 10-level prestige classes -- Knight of Boreas, Blood Guard, Mercenary of the Checkered Host, and Knight of the Alabaster Eagle. These classes are imaginative, well-balanced, and enhance the game experience by meshing with the cultures and nations of the game world (although they are easily adapted to any campaign).
High quality -- the book has been professionally proofread and is free of the errors and omissions which plague many D20 products. Well-written prose with accurate game statistics provides a fine quality product for the modern gamer.

179624.name: Godling
179624.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

In Godling you are a young God that awakens to the sights and sounds of nature. Like a child, you are curious and learn that the world has perils - you are one of them. Improve the world and annihilate it.

179625.name: MANIFOLD GARDƎN
179625.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Set in an Escher-esque world filled with secrets and mysteries, you utilize a unique gravity-manipulation mechanic to turn walls into floors. Learn to see the world through whole new perspectives as you navigate mindboggling architecture and solve seemingly impossible puzzles.

Source: The Game Website.

179626.name: Gladiadores
179626.description:
In Gladiators, each player represents one Ludus of Rome, and he will need to fight for the glory.

Each turn players can contract new slaves, train them, buy New abilities and weapons, etc..

Also you can upgrade your house to get bonuses and fight in the events. Win events gives you victory points to win the game.
The fights does not use dices,only cards.

Spanish description:
En Gladiadores cada jugador representa a un ludus romano, y tendrá que luchar para conseguir la gloria.

Cada turno los jugadores podrán contratar gladiadores, entrenarlos, perfeccionar sus habilidades,comprar armas...también podrán mejorar su ludus y por supuesto pelear en la arena para ganar el favor del pueblo.

El juego utiliza un sistema de combate novedoso que elimina por completo el uso de dados.

179627.name: Tunhell
179627.description:
Tunhell is a family card game, epic and fun in which every player is at the head of dwarves' crew and tries to amass more treasures than his opponents. Then recruit, dig at your own risks and fight!

Beardiest player can begin! Play then proceed clockwise around the table, each player taking one turn at a time until the game ends.

On his turn, a player must perform one (and only one) of the 2 following actions:

Play a Dwarf and apply its effect




OR

Recruit a Dwarf




A player can play one (and only one) «Dwarf» card on his turn. There are 4 kinds of Dwarves : Warriors, Diggers, Scouts and Blasters. Each kind has a different color and a different symbol on the top of the card. Each has a particular effect:

A Warrior can fight enemies and make the access to the mine harder for other players.
A Scout is allowed to see the 3 or 5 first cards of a Mine (depending on his Recon Value) without showing opponents...
A Digger can, of course, dig in a Mine and tries to find treasures!
The Blaster makes all the Warriors on a mine run away. All Warriors are discarded.




To recruit a Dwarf, the active player picks a «Dwarf » card available in the «recruitment center» and adds it to his hand. Then he immediately puts a replacement card face-up from the deck to have 5 cards in the row again. A player cannot have more than 6 cards in his hand.

The game ends immediately when 2 of the 3 decks of «Mine» cards are empty. Each player adds the Victory points of the cards of his loot, and the trophies he eventually obtained. The player who has the most is the big winner. Well, big…

179628.name: Flipping Flags
179628.description:
Description from the publisher:

How well do you know the flags of the world? Think you can tell the difference between the Italian flag and the Irish flag?

Flipping Flags is the fun, educational, and fast-paced card game in which players have to identify the flags of different countries. Players simultaneously flip up a flag card and shout out the country if it matches another card. Whoever captures the most flag cards wins! Perfect for parents to test their kids' knowledge about the world flags, and fun for all ages to play anywhere, anytime.

179629.name: Panda Head
179629.description:
Description from the publisher:

What's not to love about pandas?! Panda Head is a trick-taking card game in which the winning panda is the one who stays awake the longest by scoring the fewest points.

That's right: Points are bad! The more points you score, the drowsier you get, and you don't want to end up a pooped panda. Don't be bamboozled!

179630.name: Face Chase
179630.description:
Description from the publisher:

How good are you at remembering faces? Flex your facial recall muscles in this mad dash to get rid of all your cards first!

In Face Chase, you race to match any features on your cards — such as hair, eyes, nose and mouth — to the quickly changing faces on the board. Find a match and drop it fast! The first to dump all their cards wins!

179631.name: The Death of Tlangeshan
179631.description:
User summary:

An empire of the Petal Throne Adventure

The adventure takes place in Tekumel. It is heavy on investigation and very light on combat. It can be played by characters of any level provided the GM substitutes level appropriate encounters for the few creatures present.

The Death of Tlangeshan is divided into three parts. A brief journey from Tlekun to Tlangeshan's Palace, investigations of the grounds, and the discovery of Tlangeshan's Fate.

179632.description:
For millennia, the cruel and inscrutable Cephalyx have labored at their grisly work. Now the time has come for them to breach the surface, ensnaring the Iron Kingdoms in their nefarious schemes.

Forces of Warmachine: Cephalyx unearths the full power and mystery of the Cephalyx. Enslave the surface dwellers of Caen with:
• The potent warcaster Exulon Thexus and his vicious theme force, Will of Darkness
• Rules for Cephalyx warcasters, monstrosities, and the Cephalyx Mercenary Contract: Puppet Masters
• New units and solos including the Cephalyx Mind Bender & Drudges unit and the Cephalyx Agitator solo
• A painting guide to help you prepare your forces for battle
• All new fiction and background material detailing the history of the cephalyx and their terrifying agenda

Only available as a digital book from Privateer Press.
179632.name: Forces of Warmachine: Cephalyx

179633.name: Totes My Goats
179633.description: The purpose of the game is to collect the highest scoring herd of goats. Players gain points by matching herd cards and by collecting hero cards. Each card has a unique ability that comes into effect when played that alters the state of each players herd. At the end of the game there are award cards earned by fulfilling there requirement, these award cards give a final chance to line the game in your favor.

179634.name: Zombicide: Black Plague – Murder of Crowz
179634.description:
Crowz may be easy to kill, but these flying vermin can move awfully fast and, worst of all, they can ignore any obstacles, either flying over them or squeezing through broken windows, holes in the roof or gaps on crumbling walls!

Zombie Crowz only take 1 Wound to kill and grant 1 XP. Crowz have only one action per activation, but they can move up to 3 Zones per move action. But the worst part is, when they move, they ignore all obstacles. Ramparts, closed doors, even walls can't stand in their way! Once they set their target Zone, they fly straight towards it, without splitting or changing direction, and ignoring anything in their way. These winged devils will be pecking at you in no time, so you better be always prepared for them!

The Murder of Crowz box contains 15 Zombie Crowz miniatures, 12 spawn cards, and rules to play them.

Note: This item, although functioning in a similar way to Zombicide Box of Zombies Set #8: Murder of Crowz, does not expand Zombicide, and Zombicide Box of Zombies Set #8: Murder of Crowz does not expand Zombicide: Black Plague, because of the card backs. This entry allows for the correct items to be linked as expansions to the correct entries.

179635.name: Madzzle
179635.description:
Madzzle is a universe of engaging games which explores the most exciting worlds on our Planet & beyond!It was created to give anxious parents an alternative for their smartphone/ tablet hooked kids.

Madzzle has reinvented the way world looks at Jigsaw puzzles. Jigsaw puzzles always meant broken images,however with our patent pending zero gap technology, we have eliminated all gaps literally in a puzzle. This also meant that the completed puzzle could in turn become a board to play endless new games. This is how we added two more games for unending fun.
Object Hunt: In this game players race to find objects on the completed puzzle.
Data Duel: Its a trump card style game where players square off with each other based on facts and location of the object on the completed puzzle.

Madzzle also solves the biggest problem with Jigsaws i.e. that it is not portable and once completed have to be dismantled. With the help of our magnetic mat, Madzzle can be moved around and players can also roll up the completed puzzle and roll out the completed puzzle whenever they are in the mood for some Madzzle Fun.

Madzzle is available in three exciting themes- Bermuda Triangle, Mysteries of the Amazon and Worldopedia.

179636.name: Monsuno
179636.description:
Choose your Monsuno and battle using amazing Strike cards for intense action and incredible effects!

Monsuno is a two-player trading card game (TCG). Each player has three Monsuno creatures, and a hand of Strike cards used for summoning Monsuno from the "clip" or for enabling a Monsuno to attack.

The aim of the game is to knock out all three of your opponent's Monsuno.

179638.name: The Alchemist's Task
179638.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 1-3

An alchemist has a proposition for the group. She needs help recovering a hidden stockpile of magic potions and in exchange she’ll split whatever’s found with them. Sounds simple right?

The Alchemist's Task is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

179639.name: Myassari, Patron of Birth and Decay
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
179639.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who, or What, is Myassari?

At what moment does a crumbling stone pillar’s existence pass from aged into ruin? How many wrinkles on a baker’s brow does it require for him to be named olden? Why may the dancing tongues of flame strengthen the bonds of metal, yet sear those between flesh and bone? These questions are only three of the many which Myassari, the stenographer of birth and decay, holds secret within her boundless codex. Voyaging between the planes of non-existence, she summons one element at a time to study; carefully observing and documenting its every physical variance during a repetitious cycle of birth, decay, and rebirth. Because of her full understanding of human childbirth, many midwives and healers honor Myassari by wearing a ruby feather brooch for good fortune.

When Myassari must converse with material beings, she takes on the appearance of a weatherworn harpy, whose heated feathers dance and flicker like flame driven by a bellows. Those who wish to form a bond with Myassari must first be catalogued by the scrupulous patron. After crying out her name upon a blazing pyre, the PC must survive the torment of a ceaseless cycle of life and death within her vacant dimension for a full week. Having been beaten and tempered on the anvil of time, PCs bound to Myassari are requested to make offerings of rare and valuable materials to be studied by their patron, until she's documented the phases of each object and being within the multidimensional universe!

Witness the birth of a new DCC RPG Patron! Myassari, the stenographer of birth and decay, the silent observer, the deity of midwifery and time, is now ready for your ungrateful worship! All with her bearing blessed by the Dark Master himself! Download the full, 25 page patron, complete with taints, spells, and lore, on RPGNow for FREE or Pay-what-you-want!

Written by myself, Julian Bernick, and illustrated by Trevor Hartman, this patron was conceived and developed after her initial name-drop in “Cast Tower of the Blood Moon Rises!” Bring her into your next DCC RPG session! But… why, you ask?

Have you ever wanted to turn a treacherous demon-lord into a plump babe and raise him as your own son? Have you ever wanted to shroud a fellow adventurer within the mucusy secretions of a healing membrane to lessen his pains? Have you ever wanted to summon a phoenix built of boulders to smash in the brains of your foes (or allies)?

THEN KISS HER TALONS AND BEG FOR MYASSARI’S MERCY!

179640.name: Modern Basics: Jungle Action
179640.description:
From publisher blurb:

A THOUSAND DEATHS WAIT IN THE MOST ALIVE PLACE ON EARTH...

Modern Basics: Jungle Action brings players and Gamemasters tools to create exciting pulp-fiction style jungle adventures, with rules to support characters ranging in style from lan Quartermain to Tarzan to Fantomah. Feats, talent trees, starting occupations... it's all here, with an alternate spellcasting system, a few magic items, tables for generating adventure ideas, and sample characters thrown in for good measure.

Much of the material presented has previously appeared in installments of NUELOW Games' Judy of the Jungle, Princess Pantha, and The Three Lives of Fantomah series of comics/rpg hybrid books. It has been revised for this release, which includes the never-before published rules for Ju-Ju Talismans, new feats, and a new talent tree.

Modern Basics: Jungle Action is also fully compatible with NUELOW Games' other OGL d20 Modern releases, as well as the most popular OGL d20-based rules sets.

179641.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (June 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Featured Map: The Duchy of Ashlar
179641.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

GM’s Advice: Fixing At-Will 0-Level Spells
Sea Bitch at a Glance (from Village Backdrop: Sea Bitch)
Urban Dressing: Trade Town (from Urban Dressing: Trade Town)
Overview of Empire (from Ancient Empire of the Troglodytes)
Gloamhold: The Duchy of Ashlar (from Gloamhold)
Featured Map: The Duchy of Ashlar (From Gloamhold)

179642.name: Prophetic Dreams
179642.description:
From publisher blurb:

War Stories: Prophetic Dreams is a transmedia setting enhancement for Contagion Second Edition

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface, it looks much like the world you and I live in. Just beneath that surface, in the shadows, rages an ancient conflict between supernatural factions who all seek dominion over the Earth and control over the souls of humanity.

Some rare people are gifted with supernatural insight into future events. These Prophets see the future in strange flashes and hazy visions. Some see their visions as a gift or blessing, using their insight to perform heroic deeds and prevent tragedies. Others turn their foresight into a tool for personal gain and profit. Some poor souls never accept the true nature of their visions, burying their insight with medication and therapy, mistaking their power for mental illness.

War Stories: Prophetic Dreams focuses on the story of one Prophet in particular, a young woman named Cassie Koizumi, who has just recently begun experiencing visions. Feeling compelled to document her experience, Cassie begins a video blog where she recounts her dreams and insights.

War Stories: Prophetic Dreams includes:

A 12 page setting enhancement detailing new feats and a new Psychic Power for use with psychic characters.
Biopgraphical information and a pregenerated character sheet for Cassie, the character featured in War Stories: Prophetic Dreams.
A short film/video asset to be used as an in-game prop/story aid by the Gamemaster.

179644.name: The Forgotten Halls
179644.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing Drop-In Dungeons! This series of releases will feature small adventures and dungeons, generally 5 pages or less, that are effortlessly inserted into almost any campaign for the times your players zig instead of zag, and you find yourself unprepared. With the loose and opened ended way Drop-In Dungeons are written, you (the GM) can bait the hook however you want; the appetizers and desssert are up to you, herein you'll find the meat and potatoes.

The Forgotten Halls: No one can remember when the place was built, who built it, or why. But, there is no question that the “Forgotten Halls” are a place of legend among the locals. Most who have gone to explore the halls never returned, though the few fortunate souls who did were able to live comfortably from their plunder for many years.

179645.name: Spheres of Power: Expanded Options
179645.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spheres of Power: Expanded Options is the first supplemental product in the Spheres of Power line, giving players and GMs even more toys to play with for the Spheres magic system.

Inside this 29-page supplement, you'll find:

Favored Class Options for all Spheres of Power classes for both the core and several expanded races!
Conversion Archetypes for all non-alchemy casting classes from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Player's Guide and Advanced Class Guide!
Multiple Archetypes for All Spheres of Power Classes, including the Lichling (soul weaver), the Warlock (incanter), the hypnotist (eliciter), the Geomancer (elementalist), and more!

179646.name: Cychosis
179646.description:
User summary:

Cychosis was intended to be "the world's simplest RPG" while remaining fun and entertaining. The rules support both solo and group play.

Characters in the game are known as cybers--self-aware machinery--living on the planet Cyberia. They engage in adventures called treks.

179647.name: Barons of Braunstein
179647.description:
User summary:

Originally titled Braunstein!, the game has been slightly revised and re-titled Barons of Braunstein.

Barons of Braunstein provides rules for 1:1 scale historical adventure games. The intent of the game is to recreate the methods and feel of gaming in David Weseley's "Braunstein" games that were historically significant in the development of early role playing.

The game uses one player as "the judge" and the other players assume the role of a single person in the fictional town of Braunstein; typically, the focus revolves around combat though not all players need be combatants - each player has personal goals.

179648.name: Amen
boardgamepublisher: ツムラクリエイション (Tsumura Creation)
179648.description:
User summary:
Amen is an abstract stone-picking game with a theme of a struggle for the king's throne in ancient Egypt.

You begin with a stone on a corner of the square-grid board. Each turn, you roll a die and extend your wall of stones by that number. When you place stones, you place the first one on a square adjacent to any one of your stones, then place each of the remaining stones adjacent to the stone you placed last. If that square, or the line of squares beyond, are occupied by opponents' stones, instead you skip these squares and place your stone on the nearest empty square beyond them. In this case, you pick up all the stones skipped over and gain victory points. But beware. When you pick up opponents' stones, you leave a gap between your walls, which is vulnerable to their counter-attack.

At the center of the board, there are large obstacles you can use as your defense, and bonus stones which can be scored like opponents' stones.

A game consists of rounds equal to the number of players, and a round ends when three minutes of real time have passed. Everything on the gameboard is held over to the next rounds, with an exception at the beginning of the final round, when the stones on four corners are removed from the board, allowing the potential of big points.

At the end of the final round, the player who has picked up the most stones wins the game.

This game comes with a sandglass to keep track of time, and an original music CD which goes well with the atomosphere of the game.

Publisher's summary:
古代エジプト が舞台。シンプルなルールと奥深いゲーム性が特徴の砂時計を使った新感覚の石取りゲーム。オリジナル音楽CDも付いており、音楽とともにゲームを楽しめる、五感の遊戯。ゲーム内容は時計回りにサイコロを振って出た目の数だけ持ち石を盤上に置き、他のプレイヤーの石を挟んで取ります。砂時計の砂がすべて落ちきる時間（3分間）を1ラウンドとし、規定のラウンド数（2人プレイの場合＝2ラウンド、3人プレイの場合＝3ラウンド、4人プレイの場合＝4ラウンド）が終了するまでに石を一番多く取ったプレイヤーの勝ちです。

(Using Google Translate on the above Kanji text gives us: "Ancient Egypt stage. Simple rules and deep game of a new sense of stone up game of using the hourglass features. Original music CD is also attached, you can enjoy the game along with the music, play of the five senses. Game content places the stone has only the number of eyes out by shaking the dice in a clockwise direction on the board and take on both sides of the stone of the other players. Time sand hourglass as possible fell all (3 minutes), and 1 round, (in the case of a 2-person play = 2 round, in the case of a three-person play = 3 rounds, in the case of a four-person play = 4 round) prescribed number of rounds This is the most took wins player of the stone to complete.")

179649.name: Pillars of Eternity: The White March – Part 1
179649.description:
User Summary

Pillars of Eternity: The White March will increase the game's level cap, add new companions, abilities, and expand the game's story. There will also be "a new party-based AI system."

179650.name: Grimtooth's Ultimate Traps Collection
rpgissuearticle: Tomb of the Ancients: Grimtooth's Cairn-i-Fall
179650.description:
From the title page:

A gigantic collection of over 500 awesome engines of destruction, delver dicers, character crushers, adventurer anxieties, minion munchers, hero harangers, general tricks, traps, and other rare and dangerous items for use in defending game master treasures!


User summary:

Compilation of Grimtooth's Traps, Grimtooth's Traps Too, Grimtooth's Traps Fore, Grimtooth's Traps Ate, Grimtooth's Traps Lite, Grimtooth's Traps Bazaar, and Grimtooth's Dungeon of Doom, along with a bonus chapter containing new material.

179651.name: NEO AQUARIUM - The King of Crustaceans -
179651.description:
User Summary

A game based on crustaceans, you play as lobsters, crabs, and barnacles. You battle other creatures.

179652.name: Well of Darkness
179652.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 257th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a well of sinister alien stuff amidst a labyrinth of dark rock pillars.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

179653.name: Traders & Raiders
179653.description:
From publisher blurb:

Referee’s Aid 8: Traders & Raiders explores the options open to starship captains willing to operate on both sides of the law. Smuggling, blockade running, and outright piracy offer additional revenue streams to the cash-strapped merchant, but careers are short for all but the most cunning. Smart operators vary their methods, swapping from piracy to planetary raiding or hijacking when necessary, engaging in gunrunning and smuggling where there is a profit to be made… and some will even take the occasional legitimate cargo.

There are many ways to make money with a starship, even without counting profitable activities undertaken somewhere that requires a ship to get to, but which do not involve the actual ship. Some of these activities are perfectly legal and are generally considered beneficial to interstellar society. Others… not so much.

179654.name: Much Looms at the Heights of a Land Laid Low
179654.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fortified ridge. Its bosky slopes are topped with archaic forts raised from the rubble of a wall long ago fallen, all now retaken as final bastions by a people in flight. Camps below grow as folk stream in.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted ridge as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including departees, possessions, activities, fort structure and a destructive residue.

The forts and their drains could be simplified or extended using elements from Landscape: The Manse and maybe one or more of the maps also in the Location, Landscape & World bundle, most obviously The Noxious Ponds.

179655.name: Scourge of the Seven Seas
179655.description:
Treachery on the high seas!

Weigh anchor and set sail in this strategic pirate game that puts you at the helm as you race to bring home the most treasure.

The Golden Age of piracy was no time for a weak captain. Pirates needed fast ships, strong enough to withstand a barrage of cannon fire. Tradeoffs between strength and speed, often times, weighed heavily in the outcome of battles. In the quest for riches, pirates would seek to plunder hidden treasures and the ill-gotten gains of other captains. Treachery, betrayal, and danger beset even the most cunning captain. Do you have what it takes to command your ship and pillage enough doubloons to claim victory?

Scourge of the Seven Seas is a competitive or cooperative game for one to six players, each commanding a pirate ship on the high seas. Captains travel in search of hidden treasure and ship upgrades while fending off attacks and bribery attempts. The first captain to claim twenty points of treasure wins!

The object of Scourge of the Seven Seas is to be the first player to deliver twenty points or more of treasure to their home port. You score points by taking turns moving your pawn between home port and an island full of buried treasures. At the start of the game you are dealt five cards which you use to determine the initial speed and strength of your ship.

On your turn you may search for treasure, deliver treasure to your home port, draw cards at a trade port, attack other ships, or attempt to bribe dock workers. As the game progresses, players may visit trading ports to draw additional cards to increase their ship stats. You can attack other player’s ships to plunder their riches or discard cards to bribe disloyal dock workers and steal the treasures at their home port. Attacking can be risky as you might become the victim; whereas sneaking into a home port and bribing would best be done with a fast ship for your escape.

There are many different strategies to win competitively. The goal in team or single player mode is for at least one player to gain twenty or more points of treasure before Davy Jones releases the Kraken. Each player chooses a ship from a fleet of six different ships (Galleon, Frigate, Man O’ War, Schooner, Corvette, or Sloop) with varying abilities. In cooperative mode, you and your team must do battle with Davy Jones as he tries to block you from delivering treasures. All the while, a doom clock counts down to Davy Jones becoming strong enough to release the Kraken on your team.

179656.description:
Bored after guessing your suspect? We present you with a new challenge - discover the motive of the crime. If you succeed, one of the suspects is discarded before trying to reveal the true murderer!

The mini expansion consists of 14 cards - 7 for the Ghost and 7 for the Players (due to manufacuring reasons, they have the same backs).

14 cards (120 x 80 mm)
179656.name: Tajemnicze Domostwo: Motive cards
boardgamepodcastepisode: Vox Republica 097: Going Gaga for HABA

179657.description: Imperial Settlers: Exploration Tiles is a mini-expansion consisting of four new tiles that make passing early in a round of Imperial Settlers a viable option. Now after passing, you send your scouts to explore the neighborhood — i.e., choose one of the tiles — and they return with bonus cards, resources, etc., whatever you choose that is still available...
179657.name: Imperial Settlers: Exploration Tiles

179658.description: Tired of finding the same items over and over again? We've got new seven for You and a handy bag for all of them!
179658.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Discovery Tokens
boardgameexpansion: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
boardgamefamily: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island

179660.name: Rare Replay
videogamehonor: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
videogamecompilation: Digger T. Rock: Legend of the Lost City
Solar Jetman: Hunt for the Golden Warpship
179660.description:
User Summary

To celebrate Rare’s 30th anniversary the Rare collection offers 30 games for $30.

From the back of the box:

Inspiring worlds. Beloved Characters. Unforgettable fun. Rediscover 30 hit games with Rare Replay.


Lovingly Presented for Xbox One



Enjoy over 60 minutes of behind-the-scenes footage



Are you ready for an epic collection of endless gameplay and 10,000 Gamerscore?

boardgamehonor: 2016 Premio Alfonso X Mejor Juego Nominee
2016 Premio Alfonso X Mejor Juego Winner
179661.description:
Legend says: The one who brings back the 4 stones of the King KINMO's crown will be elected as the new leader of the Order of the Jungle.

KINMO is a fast and easy to play game, in which you try to form groups of action cards and collect stones of different colors. This is accomplished by taking cards from a single deck, and everyone must choose how much cards to discard in order to take news cards. Also, you can pick up stones, deal damage to your opponents or cure yourself.

Spanish version: La leyenda dice que aquel que recupere las 4 piedras de la corona del Rey KINMO será erguido como el nuevo líder de la Orden Selvática.

From publisher
179661.name: KINMO

179663.name: Light Bound
179663.description:
User Summary

Your robot picks up weapons and tries to evade or kill enemy forces. There is an Arcade Mode in which you battle computer enemies and a time limit, as well as an Arena Mode where you battle other robots (which can be computer or human) to fulfill various victory conditions (like kills). The main difference to other games is the curious navigation of the rooms, which have odd shadows so that entrances to parts of the map appear differently depending on your location; essentially, there are entrance points that only become traversable light areas when you approach them from different points.

179664.name: Third Age: Eternal
179664.description:
Ho, traveler! If you would wander these lands, you must prepare yourself; pitiless death stalks all those who roam far here. Carry with you strong iron blades, and cover your shoulders with heavy cloaks. Select with care those hale companions whom you can stoutly trust. I pray ye have honed your skills in combat, or perchance taken on the trade of magics. You will find many aged relics on your path: make use of them, if ye will. For there are those who would pursue you, and their steel is sharp, their ilk stalwart, their wits keen. The fragments of that ancient alliance weaken now, and the tenuous peace of this age threatens to expire…

Third Age: Eternal exists in an exciting universe where beasts, known as the Awakened, inhabit a land that would not be unfamiliar to the player. As a modular card game, one must select a cadre of heroes, outfit them with arms and armor, call upon the aid of companions, and employ skills and actions to face the opposing player in battle.

In Third Age: Eternal, vitality, a card’s life force, is also one’s main form of currency, and a delicate balance must be stricken to win—so weigh your defenses against your offenses or you may quickly find yourself overrun. Certain cards or abilities require additional payment in the form of exhaustion, a card’s capacity for exertion; but overwork a companion or gear and you will find it will expire. In Third Age: Eternal, one must constantly balance one’s own vitality and exhaustion, which ensures a challenging game of tough choices and rich tactics.

Each deck in Third Age: Eternal can play through wildly different strategies. You may be a hero whose skills with the gun are all you need; or strike among an army of companions and ride into battle with your brothers-in-arms. Or maybe you’re a mercenary of magic and action, and you will weave great firestorms to devastate even the largest forces. The possibilities are endless, but you must be clever if you wish to be standing after the dust settles…

Third Age: Eternal is a robust and customizable game that is unmatched in its flexibility of strategy.

179665.name: Founder
179665.description:
Founder is a table-top strategy board game that revolves around entrepreneurship. Talent management is key here. Players must decide how many and what kind of employees they need to make their business successful. Furthermore, knowing when to promote them and how to keep a balanced work force play important roles in determining the company's success.

Founder is played across 5 turns, and each turn consists of a number of phases. First, players Invest (recruit, run payroll, advertise, build factories). Second, they Produce (design products, buy resources, trade resources, manufacture). Then, they Sell (generate and fulfill demand), before Managing Talent (promote, compensate, defect). In the final turn, players Resolve (replenish resources, calculate market cap, move time marker).

In the end, the player who achieved the highest market cap will emerge victorious.

The game box will include numerous cards, a marker, pawns, cubes, paper bills and a main game board.

179666.name: Enemies Within Character Creation Supplement
179666.description:
From the Introduction:

This free PDF includes new options to make Acolytes created from the Enemies Within supplement even more unique, plus provide inspiration for building backgrounds and memorable histories. The included tables provide additional inspiration to players to flesh out personal details for their Acolytes, such as appearance and minor physical peculiarities, special homeworld beliefs, and mementos from their lives before joining a warband in service to an Inquisitor.

179667.name: Duel of Iron: The Battle of Hampton Roads, March 8th and 9th, 1862
179667.description:
Duel of Iron details the battle of Hampton Roads fought on March 8th and 9th, 1862. Union General George B. McClellan’s steady advance up the James Peninsula threatened the Confederate capital of Richmond, and a Union victory here had the potential of ending the war. A massive fleet of powerful Union warships anchored the northern army’s flank and protected their water-borne supply line.

On March 8th a strange looking Confederate steam ship, one that looked like a floating barn roof to a Union sailor who witnessed it, accompanied by other more conventional Confederate warships, sallied forth to do battle. The CSS Virginia, an ironclad warship built on the hull of the captured USS Merrimac, proved impervious to cannon balls fired from the Union warships and nearby land artillery batteries. Victory seemed within the Confederate’s grasp when action ended on March 8th, leaving two Union warships sinking and another badly damaged, with only slight damage to the Confederate vessels.

The fighting resumed on March 9th, but the Union ironclad USS Monitor had arrived during the night and its commander intercepted the CSS Virginia when it steamed out for battle. The battle between these two ironclad warships was violent, but ended in stalemate, and the Confederate’s ambitions were thwarted.
Although inconclusive in military terms, this first fight between ironclad warships marked a decisive turning point in naval warfare.

179668.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 80 - Jun 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Eidetic Memory - The Knights of the Iron Table
Random Thought Table: The Threat of the Unknown
179668.description:
Fantasy Threats

From the publisher:

You Can't Spell Wondrous or Hazardous Without Us!

Danger comes in all different kinds in medieval magical worlds. Fortunately, there are heroes to deal with this plethora of perilous problems. This month's Pyramid -- the PDF magazine for roleplayers -- looks at fantasy threats, from crypt-crawling creatures to personal problems to kingdom-claiming connivers. Its phenomenal features include:


"The Gryndel Menace," terrifying creatures that may have inspired the legends of dragons -- before maturing into something much worse! Discover GURPS stats for the monster in its various life stages, information on the deadly infection it inflicts, details on other strains of the terror, insight into how to use it in various GURPS campaigns, and other awesome info.
"Gog and Magog," a tale of the war between two goblin tribes who live in the same cave system (along with a monstrous threat that would eagerly devour them all). This adventure framework is ideal for GURPS Dungeon Fantasy heroes who want an adventure that needs more finesse than fighting, and comes with stats for the various agents involved . . . including the fearsome One Who Eats.
"The Knights of the Iron Table," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Mass Combat author David L. Pulver. It takes a familiar legend of a ruler who unites his people with a magical weapon, then gives it a sinister spin. The tyrannical Baron Vordag can be the focus of an adventure or a much more significant foe, with dangers to endure and secrets to unlock. It includes GURPS stats for key people, plus Mass Combat intel for those unlucky enough to face the baron on the field of battle.
"On the Bounty Board," a look at what happens when the heroes find themselves wanted by the law! Gain insight into how the protagonists might get in this situation -- and how could they could escape their predicament (including advice on how to use GURPS Social Engineering to further this subplot).
"More Psionic Threats," an assortment of new monsters in the tradition of GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 14: Psi. Can you handle the danger of the void wyrm, astral spiders, chaos ooze, or other mind-blowing menaces? It also comes with two new monster prefixes like those found in GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Monsters 1.


This issue also provides a Random Thought Table that ramps up the danger of the unknown, plus an Odds and Ends featuring a new Murphy's Rules that's unexpectedly out of trouble. For fantasy heroes, this might be our most dangerously different issue of Pyramid ever!

179669.name: The Office: Trivia Card Game
179669.description:
From the back cover:

Welcome to the Scranton, Pennsylvania branch of Dunder Mifflin, scene of the hit NBC sit com "The Office." Think you know your stuff about Michael Scott and his group?

Every card features two questions, including one extra-challenging question for the super fans of the show.

179670.name: Straight Shooter
179670.description:
Dexterity/shooting game with a wild west theme. Be the first to clear all of the pucks out of your area and win. Very similar to Fastrack, but for four players instead of two.

From the box:

"A rootin' tootin' disc shootin' noggin' bootin' showdown. How quick is yer draw?

This ain't no high-falutin' showdown for the sappy. This here is the real deal, rootin' tootin' disc-shootin' that'll make an armadillo curl up and high-tail it home. 'Round here, yer either the best shot or you'll be buzzard food.

Not only are ya shootin' for braggin' rights, but straight shooter helps with the way yer hands and eyes coordinate. An' don't even git me started on the benefits to yer visual perception, which helps fer when yer rindin' around town on horseback and other such activities.

The game itself is constructed of geen-u-wine wood, much finer than ol' man Jones' wooden leg. If that don't make ya skip foer joy, then maybe ya been in the sun too long".

How to play:
1. Each player chooses a character and a town to represent. Pick up all 5 pieces of yer ammo and place it in yer town.

2. As soon as the rooster crows (or someone yells "DRAW"), y'all start shootin' into each other's towns by pushing down yer ammo and springin' it off yer trusty elastic.

3. First one of y'all to empty yer town of all the ammo (Yers or another player's) is the winner. Then you git ta tell everybody else ta git outta Dodge!

179671.name: White Wolf Quarterly (Volume 1.1 - Winter 2003) / Sword & Sorcery Insider (Volume 1.1 - Winter 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Malhavoc Press Eldritch Might and More
179671.description:
From the editorial:
Hello, and welcome to the first ever White Wolf Quarterly!
Combining all the best elements of a product catalog and a quarterly special-interest magazine, this publication gives you everything you need to know about what's new and upcoming from White Wolf Publishing, including the most up-to-date release information on the books you've been waiting for. And best of all, it's totally free!

179672.name: Orgasmo
179672.description:
The pleasure has only one rule ... Make it last!

Eliminate all your opponents during wild orgies, prompting them to climax before you!
Are you able to satisfy your partner longer than the others? Use embarrassing Chances against other players, offering them more and more obscene amorous positions to make them reach Orgasm and conclude their party!
Proclaim yourself master of pleasure in an erotic race to see who “comes” last!

In this irriverent game you have to make your opponent reach pleasure by using Performance card named from 1 to 10, (the 10th card is Orgasmo, that eliminates the player who receive it).

You can also use comic action cards to keep calm your pleasure pile and increase your opponents pleasure!
The game was released in Lucca Comics And Games, with Rocco Siffredi as testimonial of the game, and soon will be presented in Europe with new professional illustrations and a lot of various adds to the Game Sistem

179673.name: Gomorraland
179673.description:
Gomorraland is a strategic card game for 2-6 players who must take control of the city, trying to eliminate their opponents to became the only boss.

Every player controls a boss who must take care of their clan, which is composed of criminals of various genres and different abilities. Criminals of a clan have to protect their master from cards, affairs and attacks from their opponents, who are trying to defeat them before the police can! This strategic game system uses both cards and dice, and it pushes every player to move carefully every single criminal to gain useful equipment or directly attack members of other clans.

179674.name: Italian Job
179674.description:
Why working when others can do it for you?!?

Survive to you Boss’ fits of rages, inventing all kinds of bullshit your mind can conceive, just to convince the token boss to do the arduous job to another of the poor players at the table!
The aim of each worker will be to make their colleagues do what he should , taking a cue from what is written on the cards!
Players must survive to a bloody working day or a task that NO ONE wants to accept!
Cheat on your boss, by taking the commitment to do it and then leave it someone else!
Threaten your colleague, lest he appoints you as his substitute to do the tedious task!
Have a great time with your imagination pretending to be engage in other tasks with the events described on the cards in your hand!
Put off, put off, put off work! Sooner or later someone else will do it!
With the ability to play a different kind of "Boss" at each game (a politician, a gangster boss, an owner of a company, etc.), as well as to make this role interpret to more players during a single game, each session of Italian Job will be different from the previous one!!!
AIM:
Depending on the number of players, wins the player (or players) who has less Hassles when the second player is out. Once reached the third Hassle, a player is out. Whenever a player will receive a Hassle, he will become the Boss. When the first player is out, he will play the role of Boss until the end of the game (that is until second player will be out)

179675.description: Dice Brewing: Red Moon Pale Ale is a promo card which was included with orders of the 2015 re-print of Dice Brewing. The promo card has a space theme, which evokes Board&Dice's new game, Exoplanets, and will most probably be available at conventions.
179675.name: Dice Brewing: Red Moon Pale Ale

179676.description: All Kickstarter backers of the expansion receives a limited edition 2015 promo card for Ancient Terrible Things, called Undead Wizard. This promo card is being produced in strictly limited numbers, and will only appear beyond the KS campaign through select outlets and at convention appearances.
179676.name: Ancient Terrible Things: Undead Wizard Promo Card

179679.description:
Women in Science is an educational card game with the goal of familiarizing players with remarkable, often unknown, women of science.

The goal of the game is to form 3 labs, each consisting of 4 cards of the same color. The first player who succeeds at this wins the game. Each turn, players choose to take a (hidden) card from the deck, or to take the (visible) top card of the discard pile. At the end of the turn, they can only keep 6 cards in hand, while the remainder gets discarded.

Besides an informative text about each scientist, regular cards have one or two background colors. Special cards exist which allow taking a specific card from the discard pile, stealing two cards from an opponent's completed lab (destroying that lab in the process, with the remaining cards being returned to the hand of that opponent), or "doubling" a regular card so it counts as two.

Cards can also be used as regular playing cards.
179679.name: Women in Science
boardgamepodcastepisode: 36 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Learning through Games
TRCP Launch Episode 1
TRCP Sunday Fund Day Episode 1

179680.description:
user summary
The Viceroy Playmat was originally available as an add-on during the Viceroy KS campaign, but can be ordered from the Mayday Games website. It is 19x10", it folds in half to fit in the box and is a neoprene mat with a cloth top.

publisher blurb
Organize your road to victory over Laar with this portable (19 X 10 inch) Viceroy playmat by Mayday Games. This slip-resistant, neoprene mat will ensure your Character Cards, Law Cards, Auction Cards and draw deck will remain in place and organized. This mat even features a Turn Track that will remind you how close you are to Victory... or defeat. It folds in half easily to fit comfortably in the game box.
179680.name: Viceroy: Playmat

179681.description:
user summary

Viceroy includes cardboard tokens as gems, but Mayday offered replacement gems as an add-on during the KS campaign. The gems are available on the Mayday Games website.
There are 64 replacement gems: 16 Blue Diamonds, Red Water Drop Rubies, Green Octagon Emeralds, Yellow- Ellipse Citrines.

packaging
Blister Pack of 64 Gems for Viceroy
179681.name: Viceroy: Gems

rpgdesigner: Hermanos Juramentados de la Espada Negra
179682.name: Espada Negra: Juego de Rol
rpgartist: Hermanos Juramentados de la Espada Negra
rpgproducer: Hermanos Juramentados de la Espada Negra
179682.description:
From Publisher Blurb:

The fantasy game that takes no prisoners. You can explore the everchanging world of the Black Sword, where honor and courage weigh as much as your own life, with its ease and deep system mechanics. In this book you will find everything you need to step into the Black Sword's world with some chances of sucess,including its mechanics and a detailed description of the setting.




Entradilla del juego:

El juego de fantasía que no hace prisioneros. Con un sistema sencillo y profundo podréis explorar el siempre cambiante mundo de Espada Negra, donde el honor y el valor pesan tanto como tu propia vida. En este manual encontraréis todo lo necesario para adentraros en el mundo de Espada Negra con algunas posibilidades de éxito, incluyendo el sistema y una detallada descripción del mundo de juego.

179684.name: Universal Adventures Flooded Room
179684.description:
From publisher blurb:

A column of silt and bubbles suddenly erupted from the bottom of the room, followed by a bloated, green hand rising from the murk.

Explore the Flooded Room, if you dare, and discover what lurks amid the murk, muck and rubble. Will you discover treasure, a monster or something else? You’ll find out when you draw a card from the Flooded Room deck. Universal Adventures Flooded Room is a bonus expansion for the Universal Adventures Adventure Module #5 Dark Water Doom, but can be used with almost any submerged, or partially submerged, area. The set includes 9 cards which determine what happens when a character searches the Flooded Room.

179685.name: The Voyage Of The Sky Maiden
179685.description:
From publisher blurb:

Airships offer passengers a luxurious journey as they cruise above the clouds. The Sky Maiden is no different. She is effectively a cruise liner of the skies for the rich and famous. Many who travel on the Sky Maiden do so to take advantage of the lavishly appointed passenger facilities and the discreet but professional security the airship affords. One such traveler is Lord Mortimer Bellington.

Lord Bellington has brought with him a treasure locked in a small strongbox and you want it. How you secure your prize is strictly up to you.

The Voyage Of The Sky Maiden is an adventure suitable for an evening’s play for 4–6 players and uses both the Fabled Environments’ “Modern Floorplans: Airship” map and the Savage Worlds core rules.

179686.name: Oscura: Lost Light
179686.description:
Descend into a world of darkness to find the shards of the Aurora Stone and restore light to the Driftlands. Wield powers of light as each level challenges your skill & lightning response in this modern adventure built upon the time-honoured mechanics of classic platformers. Each puzzle with your reaction speed will delve you further into this dark tale … but beware … Mavro the Lord Of Shadows has a few surprises in store for you.

Oscura: Lost Light is the prequel to the previous two titles in the franchise, the Webby Award winning Oscura and Oscura: Second Shadow.

Source: The Developer Website.

179687.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from ABBA, a former Swedish pop music group.
179687.name: Monopoly: ABBA

179688.name: The Excellent Travelling Volume (Issue 3 - Jun 2015)
179688.description:
The Excellent Travelling Volume
Issue #3
June 2015

Cover art by Zhu Bajie.

179689.name: Knee Jerk: Sci-Fi Pack
179689.description: A set of 10 science fiction themed cards for Knee Jerk that were available as part of the Kickstarter campaign.

179690.name: Knee Jerk: Movies Pack
179690.description: A set of 10 movie themed cards for Knee Jerk that were available as part of the Kickstarter campaign.

179691.name: Knee Jerk: Time Travel Pack
179691.description: A set of 10 time travel themed cards for Knee Jerk that were available as part of the Kickstarter campaign.

179692.description:
A box set of four Zombicide: Black Plague survivors that were designed by Karl Kopinski. The survivors include:

Garuk
Dame Ahelissa
Marcus the Mighty
Ulfo
179692.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Karl Kopinski

179693.name: Legacy of the Forbidden City
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
179693.description:
From the front cover:

It has been years since the discovery of the Forbidden City and its strange denizens. While others have sought riches and glory, your group has revenge in mind! But the city has changed and new and more deadly creatures must be defeated.

Legacy of the Forbidden City is a tournament adventure that was originally held at the Fifth Annual North Texas RPG Convention. It is designed for use with the First Edition Advanced game system and compatible with the OSRIC system. The scenario is designed for six to eight characters of 5th to 7th level.

179694.name: Unlimited VS
179694.description: Unlimited VS is a card game that let you have your favorite characters from video game or anime fight each other using various attack and support cards. Each character can gain a level after he/she is damaged by your opponent. When you are able to deal 5 damage to your opponents, you win.

179695.name: Skarb Mogorotha
179695.description: One of the first Polish game included in young people's magazine "Swiat Mlodych" (Youths world) from 29.01.1991, no 9. Simply fantasy game based on common plot, where one player is trying to reach and find treasure chest and second one is trying to interfere with him. Players command their fantasy units, for example knights, dwarves, eagle belonging to first player, and orcs, trolls, ghost of a second player. Gameplay is high despite of ancient design and graphics.

179696.name: Child's Game of Barbarossa
179696.description:
Why "Child's Game?" is usually the first thing that's asked, and after the subject matter is explained that question is usually followed up with "Is that really a topic for a children's game?"

There are multiple answers, from the ironic to the literal. We've taught kids how to play wargames on this: a 11-year-old and two 13-year-olds. It's also a good game to start a novice wargamer on. It's not too complicated and the rules are pretty easy. A better question is "Why would two old wargamers who've played all the monster games design and play a game like this?" Because it captures the ebb and flow of the East Front, it's playable in 2 hours, and the outcome is rarely decided until the final turn if the players are evenly matched. It's pretty likely that neither player will quit in 1942 or 1943 either. But enough of that.

The map is 11 x 17, and there are about 75 counters of equal game-play value, but of widely varying "flavors" from the "5th Ski Brigade" to the "Stalingrad Front." The map is a grid of squares, somewhat resembling a checkerboard over which the map has been superimposed. Movement is along rail lines and overland, but bad terrain cannot be entered. Turns are quarterly. Combat is resolved without dice, and the CRT varies from turn to turn. There are subtleties in strategy and movement that become more apparent after a couple of games.

Rules are on-line for inspection. See the publisher's web site.

rpgitemversion: First Printing, Special North Texas RPG Con Edition
179697.name: The Raven and the Lone Star
179697.description:
From the back cover:

A ship lies in the frozen tundra of the far north. Its history is lost in time, but its future may spell doom for unwary adventurers.

This special module is the first in a series that supports the Raven Foundation. Each year, the Raven Foundation will send a deserving youth to the North Texas RPG Convention.

This module includes three new monsters and two new magic items.

This adventure is designed for the First Edition game using six to eight characters of first level.

179698.name: The Miller's Blunder
179698.description:
From the front cover:

The miller of Afonsby has made a terrible mistake! His lust for riches threatens to take the most precious possession away from him...his daughter! A local clergyman may have an answer to the dilemma but needs the help of brave adventurers to find an ancient artifact. Can the heroes find the magical item in time and save the young girl from certain death?

The Miller's Blunder is an exclusive adventure for the March 2015 Mythoard. It is designed for three to five players with characters levels 5 to 7.

179699.name: The Dinner Guests
rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
179699.description:
Introduction

This is a short adventure for Trail of Cthulhu. The characters are family members: a father, a mother, and as many children as needed. The family also has a small dog. The game happens in the 1930s in a small suburban area in the USA.

179700.name: London, on the Shores of Lake Hali
rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
179700.description:
Introduction for the game:

The Hook

London in the 1930s. The investigators are contacted by Sir Charles Wolfe, a patron of the brilliant young architect Matthew Cole. Matthew has not been seen for several weeks and Sir Wolfe has no trust in the police to do their job. Can the investigators find him?

179701.description:
Game of Phones works along the lines of Apples to Apples, with one player serving as judge each round and the other players usually trying to do something so that the judge awards them the point for that round.

For this game, all of the challenges involve you using your smartphone. More specifically, the judge draws a card for the round and reads the prompt to everyone else, e.g., "Find the best #selfie" or "Show the last photo you took" or "Find the weirdest Google Image search result for your name". Everyone finds something on their phones and shows the judge, who then chooses a winner for that round. The first player to win ten rounds wins the game.
179701.name: Game of Phones
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 53- Elysium and GenCon 2015 Preview

179702.name: Madder Than a Hatter
179702.description:
You have noticed that your small city is lacking a proper haberdashery. Who better to fill that need than you? You love hats! With a wallet full of cash and a newly signed lease, you set out to open your very own store. Unfortunately, a few other individuals have had the same idea and open their own stores. To make matters worse, there's only one hat maker in town! Compete with your opponents to stock your shelves with the best selection of hats while sticking them with stock they won't be able to sell.

Madder Than a Hatter is a hybrid of take-that and set collection mechanisms. On your turn, you must place one hat into any player's inventory and take the first hat off of the hat maker's assembly line. Some hats are premium and allow you to manipulate the player's inventories or the hatters assembly line. After all hats have been played, points are scored and a new round begins. Points are scored for having only one hat of a style, or for having a monopoly on a style. Play a number of rounds equal to the number of players, then whoever has the most points wins!

179704.description:
The Lost Treasures expansion brings exciting changes to the land of Speros with two new artifacts, four new generals, and 24 new terrain cards.

Open up new avenues for conquering Speros with these lost treasures!
179704.name: Conquest of Speros: Lost Treasures Expansion

179705.name: 'Neath the Shadow (Issue 1)
rpgissuearticle: What the Guards Have to Say
179705.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Neath the Shadow is an infrequent 'zine dedicated to the Age of Shadow role-playing game.

Within its pages you will find a variety of different articles (from adventure locations to new items & monsters*) that will provide you with a little extra content and/or inspiration for your adventures and campaigns.

The 'zine is presented in an A5 format (making it ideal for booklet printing - an option available in most pdf readers), and is provided as both a black & white and a full colour booklet.

Also note that, while any game related mechanics/statistics are geared towards the Age of Shadow RPG, most of these articles should be compatible with other percentile based games with little or no modification.

(*please be aware that early drafts of a couple of these articles have previously featured on the Crooked Staff Blog)

179706.name: Ludwig's Labyrinth
179706.description:
Ludwig's Labyrinth is a Dungeon Crawl for 2 to 4 Brave Players.

In Ludwig's Labyrinth you take on the role of an intrepid Adventurer, Wizard, Berserker, Thief, Ranger, Knight or Warrior as you bravely traverse the challenges of an ever changing dungeon to see who can emerge victorious from its dark and dangerous depths.

Ludwig, “The Grinning Trickster” has packed the dungeon with vicious monsters, mystical magic, honed weapons, ancient elemental stones and strength enhancers for players to compete over. And of course plenty of gold to satisfy a thirst for riches.

Welcome, brave explorers, to Ludwig's Labyrinth

Right out of the box the game comes with
3 Levels of Difficulty that can each be paired with...
1 of 2 Modes of Gameplay for a total of...
6 DIFFERENT WAYS TO PLAY!

MODE1 - Dungeon Runner:
