Each player will create their own labyrinth path of 8 cards, race to last room then flip the cards over, to reveal a brand new path of 8 new rooms. First to make it back to the START wins!

MODE 2 - Last to be Lost:
All players, together, will lay out 19 of the labyrinth cards in a large hexagonal formation composed of chosen challenges and random cards. All players will start in the middle of the labyrinth. If a player's HP hits 0 they are immediately eliminated. Last player left alive, WINS!

PLUS...
With the design of the game's components and cards it is easy to create house rules and custom dungeons and modes. Don't just let Ludwig have all the fun. Make this labyrinth your own!

179707.name: Drongo: Ruins of the Witch Kingdoms
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
179707.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drongo, on the edge of Shade Space, is a terrifying world that offers unlimited opportunity for the brave few and lingering painful death for all but the strongest. Any who would tarry here must fear the possibility of being summoned before the Bone Throne of the mad Tyrant and called to account for their presence in his demesne.

A campaign setting for OSR SciFi games.

This version is specifically written for use with Dungeon Crawl Classics.

179708.name: Subrace: Highland Elves
179708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Highland elves are a race of fey-kin that settle disputes through gentile athletic duels of boxing, sharpshooting, or other such sport. Their magic is expressed through the strength of their arms, allowing these pixie-like people to trade blows with giants on equal terms, even if just for a limited time.

In addition to the elven subrace, you'll find five new weapons the highland elves love to kill with!

179709.name: Roll With Words
179709.description:
designer blurb

Let your words do the rolling, not your dice!

A great new way to game when you don't have any dice.

Write your name or other phrase in one line of squares, then translate the letter into the roll of the die underneath the letter. Cross off the letters as you use them. Fill these cards with several quotes (your favorite movies, music, book, etc.) and alternate between cards to keep things even more random.

Roll With Words can handle all popular size dice rolls, multiple rolls, and even percentile dice. It also has blank charts that can be used to emulate any number sided dice you have.

179710.name: Outchasers
179710.description:
Outchasers is a 1v1 strategy card game where players pick a mech and pilot and battle each other over a resource called ‘cores’. Players use equipment cards to build weapons and armor, strike their opponent directly, and collect Cores which give lasting benefits until they can destroy their opponent. Alternatively, if a player can collect five cores before their mech is destroyed, they win the game.

Within the 72 card Outchasers starter pack is everything 2 people need to play the game; 6 Pilots and 6 Mechs to combine however you choose, 5 of 10 Cores randomly placed into each game, and 48 Equipment cards split between each player. With multiple strategic formats of varying difficulties, every single head-to-head match offers the perfect balance of strategy and luck to make sure each game is a unique experience, all brought to life by the amazing art of Brett Nienburg.

179711.name: The Great Minecart Race
179711.description:
From the back cover:

A great and dangerous race through the Helmsward Mine has been created by the dwarves of Belgendum. A prize of 1,000 silver coins awaits the victors of the First Annual Minecart Race! The first team down to the bottom of the mine that retrieves the wooden idol of Thrinbor and returns it to the town officials wins. Sounds simple enough, eh?

Who will win the Great Minecart Race?

From the front cover:

The Great Minecart Race is an exclusive adventure for the 2015 North Texas RPG Con. It is designed for four players with experienced adventurers.

179712.name: Dream of Pixels
179712.description:
Dream of Pixels is a beautiful falling blocks puzzle game. The brilliant twist on the old classic is the unpacking of tetromino blocks in place of the usual packing. Simply tap on the descending grid to unpack the tetrominos and watch them spin, rotate and drop with gravity. Clear the lines from the beautiful cloudy grid fast enough or it's - dream over.

Source: The Developer Website.

179713.description:
Objective: be the first player to reach space 40 (and learn more about milk and milk products).

Typical Roll & Move game, similar to Game of Goose. Certain spaces (marked in red) trigger a special effect described in the rulebook.

Note:
published ~ mid 1930s; printed by Schettlers Erben A.G., Köthen (Germany)
179713.name: Milch

179714.name: Scavenge the Sands
179714.description:
From the back cover:

Traveling for months in unfamiliar lands, the adventurers and their families have finally secured a water source. Food however, is the same persistent problem. After a recent wind storm, someone spotted a strange hill to the north - a sandy dune with many doors, seemingly abandoned...what could this be? You have been selected to scout this new area, to search for food and more importantly, threats to your new encampment.

The first adventure specifically designed for the new TSRS Science Fiction variant!

From the front cover:

Scavenge the Sands is an exclusive adventure for the 2015 North Texas RPG Con. It is designed for three to five players with starting adventurers.

179715.name: The Extraordinary Life and Times of Nigel Farage, Gentleman
179715.description:
User Summary

A collection of satirical mini-games based on the campaign of UKIP leader Nigel Farage for the May 7, 2015 UK General Election. Collect swing votes, hide your foreign family, win debates and defeat Europe!

179716.name: The Sinister Secret of Sweetmeade Abbey
179716.description:
You have been chartered to explore the alleged ruins of Sweetmeade Abbey.

Seek out these ruins and determine if it is the Abbey.

There are long-held rumors that a great deal of specie is hidden somewhere in the Abbey. The order was known to be very prosperous.

-Tim Kask
Inside cover

179717.name: The Reviewer
179717.description:
User Summary

An entry for Ludum Dare 32, The Reviewer puts you into the shoes of a student trying to get hired by a video game review website. You're playing games and, based on your own on-screen comments (and later, public opinion, or constraints from the publisher), must submit an appropriate review within the deadlines.

The Reviewer is intended as a parody, making fun of the pressures faced by professional game reviewers.

179718.name: Black-Handed Henry's Potion Party
179718.description:
Black-Handed Henry, famed reaver captain of the pirate ship Darkest Day, has decided that in order to defeat the Heroes of Crystalia he needs potions of his own. Captain Henry has conscripted various monster alchemists and detained them in his ship. Captain Henry will grant freedom to the first alchemist who completes his potion. As for the others, the plank of the Darkest Day awaits…

Black-Handed Henry’s Potion Party, a dice matching game for 2-4 players, using the Super Dungeon dice. Players assume the role of a captured alchemist, trying to complete Captain Henry’s potion before the others. Of course, as bad guys, a little sabotage may be in order.

This stand-alone dice game comes complete with a full set of 16 Super Dungeon game dice, rules booklet, 8 unique Alchemist cards featuring new and exciting characters, and 8 unique potion recipe cards.

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
179719.description:
Description from the publisher:

Risk: Game of Thrones, based on the epic HBO series, features two ways to play, including factions of noble Houses vying for control of Westeros during the time of The War of the Five Kings, as well as Daenerys Targaryen's rise to power in Essos.

War and chaos have descended upon the realms of Men. In Westeros, the death of Robert Baratheon has created a power vacuum with rival Houses competing for control of The Iron Throne. Meanwhile, in Essos, Daenerys Targaryen is building an army to contest the rule of the Ghiscari slavers, before returning to reclaim The Iron Throne. There are 3 different ways to play RISK Game of Thrones:

1. SKIRMISH
Basic version designed as an introduction to RISK Game of Thrones game play. Once you are comfortable, move on to Dominion.

2. DOMINION
Advanced version of RISK Game of Thrones including Objectives, Characters, and Maester cards, offering more in-depth strategic action.

3. WORLD AT WAR
Play with both maps and up to seven players using either the Skirmish or Dominion rules.

RISK Game of Thrones includes two game board maps and seven House armies. Westeros map is for 3-5 player game and Essos map is for 2 player game. There is a deck of territory cards for each map, and these function in a similar way to the original RISK gameplay. When playing Dominion rules, the character cards can grant special abilities to your House, the maester cards can grant tactical advantages during deployment and battles, and objective cards create goals and strategies for earning Victory Points.

Skirmish rules are most similar to the original RISK rules. There are minor thematic variations to suit the new map. The winner is determined by which player controls the most territories, castles and ports when the end game card is revealed.

Dominion rules add the additional mechanics and cards described above. Instead of simply trying to control the most territories, castles, and ports you are now trying to achieve specific Objectives to earn Victory Points, furthering your efforts to consolidate power and establish dominion over the rival Houses. Objectives are worth from 1 to 4 Victory Points, based on the difficulty to achieve them. The first player to earn 10 Victory Points while also controlling their Seat of Power wins the game.
179719.name: Risk: Game of Thrones
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

179720.name: Monopoly: Jurassic World
179720.description:
Description from the publisher:

Monopoly: Jurassic World delivers more dinosaurs, more attractions, and lots of buying and selling as you attempt to rule Jurassic World. Collectible tokens, Jurassic World money, and a custom Jurassic World dinosaur-inspired game board provide an exciting twist to classic Monopoly.

179721.name: Hydras in Hats
179721.description:
Hydras in Hats is a light and fun game of match-making and deduction for 2-5 players.

To begin, players are dealt a secret goal card defining what heads and hats they want growing on the hydra. On their turn, a player draws two hydra cards, selects one, and uses it to cover an existing head, showing two new heads in its place. Once a player matches six heads on the hydra to their goal, they win!

179722.name: Casters Against the Multiverse
179722.description:
Casters Against the Multiverse is an unofficial and unauthorized fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity with a fantasy and gaming theme.

Includes 30 black call cards and 70 white response cards that blend in with your Cards Against Humanity deck.

179723.description:
Sharp your claws and fangs, avoid disasters , meteors and gather the strongest dinosaurs!

Dino Twist is a family game of cards , fast and smart, where players will have to fight the Dinos on the island of Twist, then recover them on their islands to score the most points. But beware to the events that will spice up the battles !!!

The goal of the game is to have the strongest Dino on our island.

How to play.
At the begin chose randomly 10 events on the 25, it will give a 10-15 mn game.
At the beginning of each turn, you reveal a event that apply for all players (except the first turn).
All players together, choose Dino from their hand, place it face down and reveal simultaneously.
If you play the same Dino (same species and same strength) you can't attack the Island of Twist and you discard your Dino in the cemetery.
The smaller Dino strike first, attack the Dino on the Island of Twist, and take it back to is own Island.
Each species can only attack their specie.
To attack a Dino, your Dino must be strongest (look at the number of strength)

At the end of the 10 events, the player with the most point on his island is the winner.

There is bonus, for the player who finish the Island first, second and third, and the player with the most Dino with big claws).

In the game, you have two different Island, one for children, initiation and one for adult more advanced game. In the advanced game you will have to respect the territories and species, whereas in the children game, you will be free to put any Dino of any species on your Island.
179723.name: Dino Twist
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 3: About Asmodée

179724.name: Plänemacher
179724.description:
Promotional game for Commerzbank in Germany.

The game title means Business Plan as players are asked to give their plans to the bank who will then give them a loan and, hopefully, the players will make a profit before the game ends.

The game is a simple roll and move game. However there is some choice because each player has two pawns and may move both by splitting the dice roll; i.e. You roll a 5 and a 2, one pawn may move 5 and the other 2 or vice versa. The board squares feature many actions that may be taken or investment opportunities that may be taken up.

The game ends at the end of a round when a pre-determined time has run out. The player with the most money, wins.

179725.name: Farm Expert 2016
179725.description:
User Summary

Farm Expert 2016 has you manage your farm, cultivate fields, plant crops, and raise animals as well as buying and selling your own products and new equipment.

179726.name: Il Bestiario di Eymerich
179726.description:
User summary:
New rules and monsters for Il Mondo di Eymerich RPG

179727.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Tarocchi
179727.description:
User summary:
Tarot card deck composed by 22 Major Arcana

179728.name: Think
179728.description:
Think is a Trivia game with 5 knowledge areas.

On each player's turn, another player takes a new Card for reading the question(s).

On each Card there are 5 questions, for one each knowledge area. Which question is asked is determined by rolling 2 dice.
Rolling doubles or 6s results in a special effect, such as getting a free Point or getting 2 questions.

Different numbers (without 6) gives the active player the possibility to choose the knowledge area.

1 question/area on each card is bold. This is the master question where you bet 2 or 3 of your previous owned victory points, for doubling or loosing them.

In the small editions the actual Player gets the card for knowing the answer, in the big boxes there are additional "nuggets" (black stones) for counting the victory Points.

Game Ends when 1 player has a predetermined amount of victory Points.

179729.name: LEGO Worlds
videogamehonor: 2016 Gamescom Best Casual Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Gamescom Best Family Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Gamescom Best Social/Online Game of the Year Nominee
179729.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.





EXPLORE. DISCOVER. CREATE.LEGO® Worlds is an open environment of procedurally-generated Worlds made entirely of LEGO bricks which you can freely manipulate and dynamically populate with LEGO models. Create anything you can imagine one brick at a time, or use large-scale landscaping tools to create vast mountain ranges and dot your world with tropical islands. Drop in prefabricated structures to build and customize any world to your liking. Explore using helicopters, dragons, motorbikes or even gorillas and unlock treasures that enhance your gameplay. Watch your creations come to life through characters and creatures that interact with you and each other in unexpected ways. In LEGO Worlds, anything is possible!

Explore and Discover the Surprises within LEGO® Worlds

• Uncover hidden treasures in environments that range from the fun to the fantastical

• Make your worlds come to life with customizable characters, both friendly and fearsome

• Race, soar, zoom, and ride on a variety of vehicles and creatures from diggers and helicopters to horses and dragons

Create and Customize your own LEGO World

• Build any world you can imagine using the brick-by-brick editor tool and prefabricated LEGO structures

• Modify terrain quickly and easily with the multi-tool.

• Customize your characters in a wide variety of outfits and options.

• Play with a select number of real-life LEGO sets, taken from the Classic and current LEGO themes!

• Export your creations and save them to use again.

Source: The Game Website.

179730.name: Cuphead
videogamehonor: 2015 Game Critics Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Critics Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
179730.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.





Cuphead is a classic run and gun action game heavily focused on boss battles. Inspired by cartoons of the 1930's, the visuals and audio are painstakingly created with the same techniques of the era, i.e. traditional cel animation (hand drawn & hand inked!), watercolor backgrounds, and original jazz recordings. Play as Cuphead or Mugman (in single player or co-op) as you traverse strange worlds, acquire new weapons, learn powerful super moves, and discover hidden secrets. Cuphead is all action, all the time. Do you have what it takes?Source: The Game Website.

179731.name: The Legend of Zelda: Triforce Heroes
videogamehonor: 2015 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Winner
2015 Gamescom Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Winner
2015 Golden Geek Best 3DS Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
179731.description:
In the visual style of the critically-acclaimed The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds game comes a new adventure. In this journey, three players team up– each as Link – to cooperatively make their way through inventive dungeons and battle bosses. Use the new Totem mechanic to stack three Links on top of each other to reach higher grounds and solve puzzles. Collect loot to create wearable outfits, each with a different boost or ability.

Features:

Similar visual style and top-down view of The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds.
As Link, buddy up with two other Link characters and cooperatively solve inventive puzzles to progress through the game.
All three players share hearts, so they must work together to defeat enemies and solve puzzles.
Stack three Links on top of each other with the new “Totem” mechanic, which makes it possible to reach new locations to solve puzzles.
Collect loot to create wearable outfits, each with a different boost or ability. Each dungeon is structured with four main areas.
Single-player mode allows the player to rent two paper dolls to take along to complete the team of three and face challenges in dungeons.
Choose from a set of emoticons to communicate with each other while playing in multiplayer mode.
Team up with two other players in multiplayer mode via local wireless connection, online** and with download play.

Source: The Game Website.

179732.name: Mario & Luigi: Paper Jam
videogamehonor: 2015 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
179732.description:
Paper Mario jumps out of a book and into the bizarre adventures of Mario & Luigi, resulting in hilarious, and dangerous, hijinks! Become the superstar team of Mario, Luigi and Paper Mario to take on quests, take down enemies, and untangle these two unique universes in this playful new entry in the Mario & Luigi series.

Features:

Characters from the Paper Mario universe – including Paper Mario, Princess Peach, Bowser and Toad – jump out of a book and into the world of Mario & Luigi, resulting in hilarious and dangerous hijinks, trademarks of the Mario & Luigi franchise.
Take advantage of Paper Mario‘s unique skills, like slipping through cracks, making copies of himself and folding himself up.
Take down Bowser’s army of dastardly villains, solve puzzles and embark on quests as a brand-new trio of heroes.
Got rhythm? Show off the moves of your giant papercraft by charging it up with dance and strut your way through battles with other giant papercrafts from Bowser’s army.

Source: The Game Website.

179733.name: München ist ja soooo schön!!
179733.description:
Easy roll die and move game for Munich tourists.
The board shows Munich with its sights and streets. The streets are crossing each other, which means the players are free to choose their way on the plan.
Each player gets a card with a list of sights.
He has to make a sightseeing tour visiting his sights.
The players sights give him 5 points (automatically stop on the field), other sights (exact hit with the die number) give additional 2 Points.
Game ends when the first 3 players are back at the train station (also the start field). From them the player with the most points wins the game.
There are event fields which may help or hinder the players way.

179734.name: Terra Incognita
179734.description:
User Summary

The Terra world is in trouble and you, as the player Alexis, fall from the sky but without memories of your past. You pick up allies and fight various enemies in JRPG turn-based play. The visuals are retro and the conversation would not be out of place in JRPG retros either.

179735.name: Breakable
179735.description:
Breakable is a game of futuristic ground and air combat for 2 to 4 players. Its set in the same future-history as Inteformic's earlier release Unbreakable.

You decide what forces and weapons you need to complete your mission. Employ fast but vulnerable skimmers to deliver a lightning blow to your opponent. Or choose sturdy tanks armed with heavier weapons. For defense, nothing beats the staying power of your bunkers. And don’t forget recons; shadow warriors who can infiltrate behind enemy lines to call in nuclear strikes from afar.

Then equip your units with nukes, lasers, autocannons, cluster bombs and more. Thanks to advanced materials technology your units are hard to kill, but still breakable.

179736.description:
A dice driven child game.
The story behind is,that the Player try to dive for a treasure which is garded by a octupus.
There are action fields, where the player has to draw a card and has to answer questions or make Actions (e.g. acting a special situation.
The Player who is first back on the ship with his treasure wins.
179736.name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark Abenteuer unter Wasser

179737.name: Box Cat
179737.description:
Box Cat is a retro arcade smasher created for iOS, Android and Ouya! Smash into cars and create traffic mayhem!

Drive Box Cat towards oncoming cars with tilt or touch controls. Progress through Adventure mode to complete achievements, unlock new Cats and discover the world of Box Cat. Battle waves of cars and trucks in the relentless Survival Mode. Enjoy life while smashing through 7 lanes of heavy traffic in Rush Hour mode.

WHY BOX CAT?
-Smash Cars
-Dash Trucks
-Become “Super Box Cat”
-Hear an original chiptune soundtrack
-Unlock Cats
-Leaderboards & Achievements

Source: The Publisher Website.

179738.name: Ostfront
179738.description: Ostfront is H&S GAMES newest tactical infantry print-and-play project. June, 1941, as a German platoon leader you will fight your way across Russia in a tactical tour de force. Each month you will take part in engagements against a random number of Soviet squads and accumulate victory points which facilitate promotion, unit upgrades and awards. Single, tournament style engagements or one of two campaigns may be played. Designed from the ground up as a solitaire system, the game's brain is an innovative hex template that is used for unit placement. This primary system works in concert with a proven chit pull sub-system and action charts which dictate if an enemy unit moves (if so what direction) fires, or does nothing. The map is framed by a slew of information which you must keep track of including: squad action points, leader action points, sudden death track, sniper track, month track, weather, initial German deployment, expected level of enemy resistance, engagement type (three possible types), arty/air strikes, and a victory point track. The map is a generic, base map upon which terrain tiles are configured according to the given scenarios or simply your own whim! Combat is comprised of a combat results table that determines the number of step losses and subsequent pinned, suppressed or broken results. Or, you may chuck the primary combat engine for an alternative "buckets" of dice combat engine! Close combat is brutal and there are no guarantees in this game. Units will often have to roll to perform an action,and at game start, you will have to spot an enemy before you can fire at it. Finally, all of this occurs on a modest 7x9 hex grid!

179739.name: Kunterbuntes Lernmobil
179739.description:
This is an electronic-based educatioan boardgame.

There are exchangable cards. On each card there 8 pairs of matching things. The players have to find the matching pairs and touch them with a finger on both. The sensors behind the card will give a signal if this is a pair or not.
First step is learning Colors, later Levels are about numbers and words.

179740.name: Vampyr
179740.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Vampyr is set in early 20th century Britain as the country is gripped by the lethal Spanish flu. Vampires prowl the streets and Jonathan E. Reid, a high-ranking military surgeon was transformed into a vampire upon his return home from the frontline. He must deal with being torn between the Hippocratic Oath and his newfound bloodthirsty nature. The player is under no obligation to kill to finish the game. Dialogue options can be used for hunting prey to feed on, which replenishes strength and levels up the lead character.

179741.description:
Wombat Rescue: Expansion Pack is a collection of expansions for Wombat Rescue - a novel game by designer Matt Wolfe in which you play a Mama wombat. The dastardly dingo has stormed your burrow and chased away 4 of your baby wombats! You will need to eat and digest food in order to produce poop cubes, with which you will build smell areas so you can navigate your environment, find your baby wombats, and bring them home. The player who best plans their smell areas and moves most efficiently will find their 4 babies, bring them home and prove victorious!

Don't be fooled by the wonderfully colorful and unique art by Polish Artist Mateusz Sxulik, or the unusual theme from US Designer Matt Wolfe. Wombat Rescue is not a kid's game. It is really a family game for ages 10 and up or a light to medium gamer's game for 1 to 4 players that takes about one hour to play!

Wombat Rescue: Expansion Pack includes the following items:

One Extra Tile Sheets - 4 extra six-hex tiles to really stretch your playing area
One set of 12 Boulders - Barriers to provide more challenges for experienced players
Dingo Protection Tiles - the Dingo will ignore you for 1 turn - perfect for sneaking around right under his nose!
Food Disk Stickers - Transform the food disks to thematic wombat food!
179741.name: Wombat Rescue: Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina

179742.name: Wimmel-Electric
179742.description:
There are 12 sheets with each 1 big image overfilled with people and things. There are 6 small parts of the big Image shown at the right side of the sheet.
One of this sheets has to be choosen and put on the board.
The actual player has to find one of the 6 small image parts in the big image.
The player touches both with the Ends of the 2 cables attached to the board. The electronic in the board will show if it's right or not.

179743.name: Bloop (iOS)
179743.description:
WARNING: HAND COLLISION IMMINENT — Bloop is a fast, frantic touch game for everyone on mobile. Two, three, or four players race to tap the most tiles…at the same time! Easy at first, but soon the tiles shrink. Hands collide. Fingers cross. Fireworks!

Each color plays a unique BLOOP sound. Hear your symphonic success or dissonant disaster. Bloop is a great ice breaker, so bring this onomatopoeic adventure to your next party!

Source: The Publisher Website.

179744.description:
Objective: Be the first to rach space 65
One of several roll&move games that came out early 1900 as the public was enthralled with expeditions to the arctic/antarctic.
The board features illustrations of the trip south, by ship and dogsled. The dice rolling trip covers the successful journey south.

Likely published in 1912 or 1913.
179744.name: Au Pole Antarctique

179745.name: The Chatsworth Game
179745.description:
The game uses an illustrated plan of a garden to form the basis for a number of games, some of which are described on the games board. Using a die players move their pieces around the map using the basic rules of not retracing their steps and following the direction of red arrows when landed on. he designers suggest creating ones own games but some of the suggestions are below.

The Grand Tour: involves trying to visit all the main sights before anyone else and returning to the house.

Race: involves all starting from the Grotto and trying to reach the Orangery before anyone else

Afternoon Tea: 15 turns try and visit as many sights as possible each with their own point scores

Chase: Involves one player getting a head start and the others trying to catch them.

rpgitemversion: Pantalla del Juez de Clásicos del Mazmorreo PDF
179746.name: Dungeon Crawl Classics Judge's Screen
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
179746.description:
From the Publisher

This year’s Free RPG Day offering from Goodman Games will make Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG fans rejoice! It’s the official DCC RPG Judge’s Screen! The inside contains three panels of the most frequently consulted tables, and the outside contains three new Doug Kovacs paintings.

179747.name: DraftCraft
179747.description: In DraftCraft, players draft a hand of resource cards that also have plans for objects that they can craft. After drafting, they craft one of their plans by spending the resource cards. The crafts generate effects such as an increase in hand size, additional resources, and discounts for future crafts. After seven rounds, the player with the highest total Victory Point value in crafts wins.

179748.name: Into the Dragon's Maw
179748.description:
From the Back Cover

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world's first fantasy RPG, and is ready to play in your home campaign!

Your stalwart band treks through the trackless jungle seeking the Dragon's Maw Waterfall. At the base of the falls, behind a massive curtain of water, is rumored to be the cavern lair of a great wyrm. The local Xulmec tribesmen say the great dragon has not been seen in nearly 100 years, so perhaps the hoard lies unguarded and ready for plunder. But what role do the heroes play in a blind shaman's prophecy foretold a century ago?

This all-new 5E adventure module includes seven new magic items, and pre-generated characters can be downloaded from www.goodman-games.com to start playing right now.

179749.name: Plumps: Ein Kreiselspiel für jung und alt
179749.description:
The board has a number of holes in it; in a turn, the player sets off his spinning top in the start area, with the intention of sending it forward towards the scoring holes. If it drops into a hole, points are scored.

First to reach a pre-agreed total of points, wins.
likely published ~1947-1950

179750.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Andrea the dance instructor
boardgameexpansion: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
179750.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

The promo card reads:

This gen.: Discard a friend from your hand anytime during your turn to gain +2 Honor for each.

179751.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Luke the lucky pickpocket
boardgameexpansion: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
179751.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

The promo card reads: Roll a six sided die and steal up to its value in gold from an opponent.

179752.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Rodney the ambassador
boardgameexpansion: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
179752.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

The promo card reads: Gain +2 for each different nationality of your family members.

179753.name: Pixel Tactics: Game Prodigy / "Lucky" Luke
179753.description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Watch It Played! Season 4 Indiegogo campaign

Card text: As an action once per wave, you can pick up 3 cards, then add one to your hand, discard another, and put the last one back on the top of your deck.

179754.name: Pixel Tactics: Sound Guy / Chaz Charlton
179754.description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Watch It Played! Season 4 Indiegogo campaign

Card text: As an action, you do 1 damage to each enemy hero. As an action, you can remove 1 damage from each one of your heroes.

179755.name: Pixel Tactics: Video Guy / Diego Melo
179755.description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Watch It Played! Season 4 Indiegogo campaign

Card text: Whenever any player plays an Order, set that card aside and discard andy existing set-aside card. As an action, you may discard 2 cards from your hand to duplicate that Order and discard it to its owner's discard pile.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
179756.name: In Defense of Thuil
179756.description:
From the back cover:

Swamp raiders from the jungle province have been harassing the small border towns of Wynhelm for years, with Thuil being a frequent target. Raiders no longer attempt to invade Wynhelm over the many small bridges spanning the Black River, but have taken to rafting large groups of warriors through the calmer sections of the water. Raiding parties of a dozen or so desperate bandits have turned in to organized troops of lizardmen and red cloaked priests. The snake god Sshanasa is surely behind these recent attacks! A low level adventure for 3-5 players set in Terra Minor.

In Defense of Thuil is compatible with TSRS, OSRIC (1E), and 5E!

179757.name: More Ranger Talents
179757.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The idea of ranger talents (and why they are a good idea) is first presented in The Genius Guide to the Talented Ranger, along with a large number of talents (many adapted from the abilities of ranger archetypes). The new talents presented here can be used with that book, or added as new options for the traditional ranger class.
To use these talents with the core ranger class, simply allow a ranger to replace any of the following class features with an edge, talent, advanced talent, or grand talent as appropriate.

Edges – combat feats, evasion, favored enemy, favored terrain, hunter’s bond, spellcasting (1 edge for each level of spells sacrificed, when the ranger would first be able to cast those spells).
Talents – endurance, swift tracker, track, wild empathy, woodland stride.
Advanced talents –camouflage, hide in plain sight, improved evasion, improved quarry, quarry.
Grand talents – master hunter.

The new hunter’s tricks use rules that can be found in The Genius Guide to the Talented Ranger or with the skirmisher archetype for rangers. Many of the prerequisites mentioned in these edges and talents are from The Genius Guide to the Talented Ranger, so a GM not using that book may need to replace them with similar talents or feats from resources appropriate to the campaign.

179758.name: The Dracomancer
179758.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Dracomancer is a new base class, designed for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. It is a spontaneous arcane spellcasting class that draws upon the themes and abilities of dragons, and has a draconic companion that acts as guard, ally, and advisor. Dracomancers are similar to sorcerers in that they have a deep connection to a source of magic power, but in the case of the dracomancer, the power source is the mystic energy all dragons draw upon rather than the mystic inheritance of an inhuman bloodline. Additionally, since the stats for draconic companions and dragon steeds (from The Genius Guide to the Dragonrider) are interchangeable, the nearly 30 draconic companions presented in The Genius Guide to the Dracomancer can be used as new steeds for the dragonrider, expanding dragon steed options to include all the imperial, outer, and primal dragons!

179759.name: You Iz Kobolds?!
179759.description:
Quick Start Game and Adventure for Free RPG Day 2015.

Includes introductory game mechanics, pre-generated characters, and an introductory adventure (assembling the human cure "chicken soup" for the ailing boss). Play time about 30 minutes, no previous experience required.

Free booklet distributed on Free RPG Day 2015.

179760.name: Cosmic Patrol Quick-Start Rules: The Doomsday Protocols
179760.description:
Distributed free for Free RPG Day 2015

Includes quick-start rules, pre-generated characters, and an introductory adventure that takes approximately 30 minutes to complete (locate and assist a missing spaceship). No previous experience necessary.

179761.name: Valiant Universe RPG Quick Start Rules: Experience the Rumble in the Bay!
179761.description:
From back cover:

Hidden beneath Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary is a massive, secret PRS facility. Powered by unknown energies, it can morph and transform itself at will to keep horrific villains, creatures, and alien entities trapped within, while allowing endless experimentation. But rumors of the facility's existence and its most prized possession have leaked, and the Valiant Universe's most powerful organizations--the Harbinger Foundation, the Sect, the Abettors, and many more--are taking an interest. And the world may never be the same...

179762.name: Shadows of a Green Sky
179762.description:
From back cover:

Shadows of a Green Sky

Open & Play
Basic Rules Included

In the long ago days before days, before the sun shone upon mountain, hill or lake, Mailahm, that is the moon, shone her lights upon the world. Hers was a gentle touch, her light a silvery hue and all the world rejoiced in the comfort of it and that age was called the Faul Mur.

But Narrheit, her brother, who was ever malicious and clever, crossed the heavens and marred her silvery light. In his wake the skies turned green and the comfort of Mailahm passed and a wrath fell upon the world. And these were called the Shadows of Narrheit, or the Shadows of the Green Sky.

So it was from that age to this, that at times, the skies turn green and doubt and wrath came to the world, for these are the echoes of Narrheit's purpose. Shadows of a Green Sky is a low level adventure designed for 3-6 characters with a challenge level of 3-5. From the burning ruins of Immesberg, to the rubble strew slopes of the Norling Mountains, plunge into the turmoil of a mad god's spite.

179763.name: HELLAS: Worlds of Sun & Stone - Free RPG Day Quickstart
179763.description:
Distributed for Free RPG Day 2015

Includes core rules for quick start play, pre-generated characters, and introductory adventure (the characters are enlisted to travel to a secure prison and help a person escape).

Landscape orientation

179764.name: Atlantis: The Second Age – Free RPG Day Prelude to Adventure
179764.description:
Distributed for Free RPG Day 2015 and Free RPG Day 2016 (with variant cover)

Includes quick start core rules, pre-generated characters, and brief introductory adventure (a ship captain asks the characters to go and find some missing crew).

179765.name: 13th Age: At Land's Edge / Night's Black Agents – The Harker Intrusion
179765.description:
Distributed for Free RPG Day 2015

Booklet has two sections, the first for 13th Age featuring quick start rules, pre-generated characters, and an introductory adventure. The second section is for Night's Black Agents and features quick start rules, pre-generated characters, and an introductory adventure.

In At Land's End the characters are passengers aboard a troubled ship. In The Harker Intrusion the characters attempt to uncover a conspiracy they have recently learned about.

rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
179766.name: Shadowrun Quick-Start Rules: Return to Sender / Battletech Quick-Start Rules: A Time of War
179766.description:
Distributed for Free RPG Day 2015

Booklet has two sections, printed opposite/upside-down so that either way the booklet is held one game is on the cover and reads correctly.

Both game systems include a quick-start guide, pre-generated characters, and an introductory adventure that is playable without prior experience in about an hour. Shadowrun has an included Gamemaster's Screen which is printed on standard weight paper.

179767.description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "Year of Hell" episode Organized Play event.
179767.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Bellerophon Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

179768.description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Temporal Cold War.
179768.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Xindi Aquatic Ship Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

179769.description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Temporal Cold War.
179769.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Xindi Reptilian Ship Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

179770.description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Temporal Cold War.
179770.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Diaspora Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

179771.description:
“Before your primate brain is too badly damaged to understand, I want to thank you for helping us destroy your world.”Xindi Reptilian Commander Dolim, to Ensign Hoshi Sato.

The Xindi come to Star Trek: Attack Wing in a BIG way! The Weapon Zero Premium Figure is sure to menace all opposing ships on the tabletop as the Xindi attempt to obliterate all in their path!

The Weapon Zero Premium Figure measures 4” in diameter!

The Weapon Zero Premium Figure also contains ship cards, tokens and more for use in Star Trek: Attack Wing.
179771.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Weapon Zero Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

179772.description:
The Emergency Force Field Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Year of Hell" episode Organized Play Event.

When using the resource, each time a ship in your fleet defends, during the compare results step, you may
1) Disable 1 of that ship's active shields to cancel 1 of the attacking ship's normal hit results.

OR

2) Disable 2 of that ship's active shields to cancel 1 of the attacking ship's critical hit results.

If a ship uses either ability, place an Auxiliary Power Token beside that ship.

The cost of this resource is a number of SP equal to the total combined starting shield values of all ships in your fleet divided by 2 (rounded up).
179772.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Emergency Force Field Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

179773.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching target space 99 and learn more about scouting.

This is a game in the style of Game of Goose. Players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawn the indicated amount of spaces. When they land on a marked (red) space, some special effect occurs.

Botes:

Pewter pawns
Likely published early 1910s
179773.name: Die Pfadfinder

179774.name: Stormbringer: Regolamento
179774.description:
From the Back of the book:
Stormbringer, il Gioco di Ruolo ispirato ai più celebri romanzi del grande scrittore inglese Michael Moorcock, vi porterà all'interno di questo meraviglioso e crudele mondo incantato, nei panni di valorosi eroi disposti a sfidare la morte in cambio della gloria.
Questo manuale contiene tutte le informazioni necessarie per poter giocare nei favolosi Regni Giovani: una chiara e completa descrizione delle terre e dei loro abitanti, le regole per la creazione e la gestione dei vostri personaggi, la magia, la religione e i combattimenti.

English translation:
Stormbringer, the RPG inspired by the most famous novels of the great English writer Michael Moorcock, will bring you into this wonderful and cruel enchanted world, in the role of brave heroes willing to challange death for glory.
This manual contains all the information needed in order to play in the fabulous Young Kingdoms: a clear and complete description of the lands and their inhabitants, the rules for the creation and management of your characters, magic, religion and combat.

179776.name: Il Canto degli Inferi
179776.description:
User Summery:
Five adventures taken from the Stormbringer 4th edition core rules manual

179777.name: Der Wichtelwald
179777.description: A simple race game in the tradition of Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a red colored space, obey the instructions glued into the lid. Target space 75 must be reached with a matching number.

179778.name: Stormbringer: Creature e Personaggi
179778.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Questo secondo volume dedicato a Stormbringer, il Gioco di Ruolo tratto dalla Saga melniboneana del celebre autore inglese Michael Moorcock, contiene tutte le informazioni necessarie per rendere le vostre avventure ancora più ricche ed emozionanti!

English translation:
This second volume dedicated to Stormbringer the Roleplaying Game, taken from the melnibonean Saga of the famous English author Michael Moorcock, contains all the information you need to make your adventures even more rich and exciting!

179779.name: Pan Tang L'isola dei Demoni
179779.description:
From the Back of the Book:
A Nord dei Regni Giovani, là dove solo i guerrieri e i maghi più potenti (o più stolti) osano portare i propri passi, vi è una terra il cui nome incute terrore: Pan Tang, l'Isola dei Demoni!

English translation:
North of the Young Kingdoms, where only the most powerful mages and warriors (or foolish) dare to travel, there is a land whose name strikes terror: Pan Tang, the Isle of Demons!

179780.name: Avventure a Pan Tang
179780.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Pan Tang, l'Isola degli Stregoni: oltre le nebbie del tempo e della razionalità, oltre la vita e la speranza... non è una leggenda. L'Isola di Pan Tang è il regno del Caos, il dominio dei demoni, il luogo ove le peggiori paure degli uomini prendono forma.

English translation:
Pan Tang, the Island of Sorcerers: beyond the mists of time and rationality, beyond life and hope ... it is not a legend. The Isle of Pan Tang is the realm of Chaos, the domain of the demons, the place where the worst fears of the men take shape.

179782.name: Het Grote Smurfenspel
179782.description:
Translated from the back of the box:
To escape the ongoing threat of Gargamel and his cat Azrael, the Smurfs left their village and moved into the forest.
The players, which get involved in this adventure, have to find the hiding place of a certain number of Smurfs and bring them back to the village. While doing this, they have to cope with Gargamel's magic, Azrael's anger and other trouble.

Kids game that combines luck of the draw with a little memory challenge.
The board consists of six locations where the Smurfs hide (closed boxes with Smurfs in it), Gargamels castle (where they have to draw cards with negative events), and the Smurf village.
Each player gets one cart that he moves across the board, visiting the different locations for the Smurfs of a certain type. When a player has a Smurf in his cart, he then has to find the matching Smurf (two of each kind in the game), and then move the cart back to the village to collect the Smurfs. First one to collect all the Smurfs on his "mission card" wins the game.

179783.description:
Description from the publisher:

Heroes of Normandie: Carentan is a scenario pack that adds new tiles, units, and scenarios to the Heroes of Normandie base game.

The town of Carentan stands in the path of the American army, which is trying to establish a defensive line against possible counterattacks. The Germans were entrenched here and defended the town with tenacity. You must either make this fortress fall by commanding the American army, or honor the nickname "Lions of Carentan", which the Fallschirmjägers earned there from their enemy.
179783.name: Heroes of Normandie: Carentan

179785.name: BLOCK x 3
179785.description:
Block Block Block is a simple, fun and relaxing puzzle game.
The basics are easy. Solve the puzzles by getting 3 blocks of the same color in a row or column.

Things get challenging however when multiple colors, moving blocks and various puzzle elements are introduced.
If it gets too hard our dynamic hint system will help you by solving only some or all of the puzzle for you.

Source: The Publisher Website.

179786.name: Despair
179786.description:
User Summary

You awake in a wrecked subway car and must seek out its cause according to the typed message on the screen. You can wander around forever trying to find clues, clomping down wet sloshy subway track, bumping down corridors, and crawling through ducts, and then you wonder what you're doing with your time on earth. And as you wonder, still nothing happens.

179787.name: The Talented Ranger
179787.description:
Publisher Blurb:

With the popular and proven edge and talent system that has already been applied to many other classes in the Talented Class line of books from Rogue Genius Games, we’ve built a new talented ranger class that can take a wide range of specialties from favored enemies and terrain to bonding to a weapon, gaining a pack of animal companions, and even becoming an ally of magic itself. While these most certainly include a number of things that could be considered forms of woodsman, they also allow for rangers as prowlers of big cities, warriors with a touch of arcane magic, and supernatural hunters who expose the secrets of the demons they hunt.

179788.name: Battle Brothers
179788.description:
User Summary

A strategy RPG where you control a mercenary company in a low fantasy setting with a procedurally generated world map, combat maps, and mercenaries. Hire your mercenaries, buy their equipment and supplies, and choose the contracts that you want to take. If one of your men dies they die for good, keep them alive with battle formations and tactics like shield and spear walls. Train your surviving men by having them learn abilities from three different skill trees and raising their combat abilities, health, initiative, and resolve. Different weapons grant different combat skills and have different accuracy, health and armor damage ratings, and range.

179789.name: Covert Ops: Berlin
179789.description:
Tabletop, 1-6 player spy game set in 1941 Berlin that combines classic mystery elements like Clue, but with a defector.
Setting. At the height of World War II, spies from around the world descended on Berlin, Germany to gain intelligence on military operations. Allied forces from countries including United States, England, and Russia engaged in dangerous clandestine operations, code breaking, and subterfuge. The secrets they obtained thwarted military advancements into Western and Eastern Europe. Now, you, the agent behind enemy lines in Berlin in the early 1940s, seek to decipher the enemy plans, avoid being caught by the Schutzstaffel, and uncover the double agent among your peers.

Gameplay. Operation Berlin is a mystery board game with a defector. The goal is to determine which military operation Nazi Germany is planning through process of elimination. Players move as spies through Berlin obtaining information and avoiding hindrances in the form of roadblocks, security guards, and Schutzstaffel. As an added challenge, players may be double agents trying to prevent the other agents from discovering the German plans. This game combines the mystery style of Clue with the player interaction of Resistance to create a unique and intriguing replaying of history.

Mystery Element: There are 9 possible missions characterized by the country of attack and type of attack. One of the missions is selected at random, unknown to the players, and placed aside as the actual secret mission. A tracking sheet assists players in eliminating possible missions when they find or trade information on what cards are not in the secret mission pile. First player to accurately guess the secret mission wins!

Defector: Based on the number of players there may be 1 or 2 double agents. By randomly drawing the agent and double agents cards at the beginning, no one knows what side the other players are on. This adds a covert element that will have players interacting, accusing, and defending until the truth is known. Double agents may choose at any point in the game to reveal their secret, allowing them to play as the German forces. If the double agent remains incognito, all players may accuse a person of being a double agent and force them to be uncovered. But if they guess wrong the game ends in a German victory!

179790.name: Backstory Cards
179790.description:
Backstory Cards

[ Taken from the back of the card box. ]

Create rich worlds for your roleplaying games'

Backstory Cards is a deck of prompts that meshes your characters and settings together, creating unexpected history and engaging plot hooks. It works with any tabletop roleplaying game system and genre.

Crave detailed character relationships? What to give your characters deep reasons to care about the setting? Backstory Cards is the tool for you.

CONTAINS: 54, cards, including instructions and 47 story prompts

179791.name: TRIP: Steam Edition
179791.description:
User Summary

TRIP is evolving from art experiment to a quirky data collection safari. You play the role of a field scientist taking pictures of fauna, flora, minerals, and other interesting sights. Despite this the game was released from early access with no sound, npcs, or fauna.

179792.name: Tabletop Hockey
179792.description: All the fun of air hockey, without the electric bill! Tabletop hockey comes with a wooden frame that surrounds the playing area and has two openings for the goals. Players each have a padded circular 'stick" (similar to the ones used in air hockey) they use to send the puck on its way to the opponents goal.

179793.name: Loco Lingo Building Site
179793.description: The popular learning game in a small format. This game from our "Loco Lingo" series is all about building sites. There is a story, a riddle, a poem, and this time there is also a little dice game! For 1-6 players and a reader. Please note: This game can be played without the other games in the Ratz Fatz series. For ages 3-12.

179794.description:
Description from the publisher:

Me Want Cookies! is a cute family game for 2-5 players in which each monster tries to be the first to find the correct dessert and gain the most points.

In more detail, you are a nice monster with a big appetite for desserts. For each course of the meal, only one monster can eat a dessert and only the right dessert. Spot it before the others devour it!

1. Roll the die to set the first dessert.
2. Follow the licorice up to the dessert at the other end.
3. Grab the right dessert!
179794.name: Me Want Cookies!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 15: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!, Trading Places, and Cardinal Quest
HLG 5: Patchwork
Vox Republica 094: The CR At Gen Con 2015 - Part 1

179795.description:
The gameboard is your battlefield. You have a fleet at your disposal including a battleship, cruisers, submarines ... Your mission: protect your flagship and capture your opponent's flagship.
Once the ships are in place advance them. When you're one space away from an enemy you must attack if your ship is strong enough (see Category groups).
If yes, opponent's ship is defeated and out of play.
Game ends after a flagship is captured.
179795.name: Deutsch-englischer Seekrieg

179797.name: Marine Fighter Squadron: A Solitaire Game of Aerial Combat in the Solomons (1942-1945).
179797.description:
Marine Fighter Squadron is a game where you are a Commander of a hard charging, high flying, gung ho, Marine Fighter Squadron (or VMF) in the Solomon Islands in the Pacific during World War II (1942-1945). Your Goal is to manage your Squadron’s crew and aircraft to successfully search for and destroy Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Forces in order to bring victory to the allied forces. Missions include Fighter Sweeps, Bomber Escort and Strikes on Japanese Air Bases and Naval Forces.

OBJECTIVE
The Objective of Marine Fighter Squadron is to manage your aircraft and Complete a Campaign consisting of a series of Missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions).

Marine Fighter Squadron can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

179799.description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Wuppertal-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.
179799.name: Stop-Over Wuppertal

179800.name: Cork and Screw
179800.description:
Cork and Screw is a card game for 4-6 players. It has 288 cards total which includes Question, Answers and Challenge cards. It won't be for everyone. It is sexual, fun and ornery.

This game holds some similarities to games like Cards Against Humanity and Apples to Apples. The difference is in order to advance to the next level, the player must complete a challenge card and be judged by the other players.

179801.name: Samorost 3
videogamehonor: 2014 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2014 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
179801.description:
Samorost 3 is point-and-click adventure game. It will be the first game in series that is full-length and with full HD graphics. The story will take place across seven planets.

Source: Wikipedia, "Samorost 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

179802.name: Pig Out!
179802.description: How long will you pig out before you chicken out? Roll pigs to score. Pig Out (keep rolling) as long as you want - but roll too many chickens and lose it all!

boardgameintegration: Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia - Kickstarter Exclusives
Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia - Kickstarter Exclusives
179803.description:
Inferno is a standalone expansion to Arcadia Quest. It is 100% compatible with the original base game and introduces four new Guilds: Sharks, Tigers, Crows, and Serpents. It features new types of heroes, such as Alchemists and Gladiators.

There is a new branching campaign system, and the storyline revolves around the guilds descending into a fiery abyss. There are Brimstone cards that make the terrain risky to navigate, which operate similarly to the Tombstone cards from Arcadia Quest: Beyond the Grave.

A new mechanism called "Damnation" will tempt the heroes with powerful weapons that can corrupt the characters over time or change the behavior of nearby monsters. There are also Angels, which are allied characters for the heroes to rescue, escort or assist. Working with the Angels can affect the branching campaign path system and even allow the player to recruit them for use in later missions.
179803.name: Arcadia Quest: Inferno
boardgameexpansion: Arcadia Quest: Inferno – Whole Lotta Lava
Arcadia Quest: Steady Slingshot Promo Pack
Cool Mini Or Not Promo Pack 2016
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 88 - If You Like Dead of Winter, Try...
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 006 – Top Kickstarter Games
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 019 – 10 Reasons to Buy a Game
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 036 – Blood Rage vs Scythe
Episode 10 - 7 Wonders vs Among the Stars
Episode 1: T.I.M.E Stories and Literally the Worst Games
Episode 23: Bloody Scotland
Episode 24: Creating a World With Miniatures
Episode 37 - Dead of Winter Halloween Spooktacular

179804.description:
Description from the publisher:

"When the city was overcome, we thought, 'This is the end.' Then they bombed us, and we were sure it was over. Somehow, I don't know how or why, but somehow we survived the onslaught. There were only a few of us, but we escaped the pit of hell that was the urban wasteland. They always say the suburbs have it better, right? They weren't hit nearly as hard; we've found a sturdy house. It still has a roof and everything. We're hungry, tired, and it's a struggle to hold back the dead from their nightly assaults, but we're still here, we're not going down yet."

Zpocalypse 2: Defend The Burbs is a standalone tower defense-style game, evolved from the original Zpocalypse, a survival board game set in a post-apocalyptic wasteland.

Like the original, two to five players each control their own squad of survivors equipped to the teeth with weapons, food, and items. In this game, your actions as squad leader allow the survivors to choose their tasks on the daily action board. Each choice has limited space and will come with benefits (potential for more supplies) and costs (like all things in the Zpocalypse, it's never pleasant!)

With gained experience, your survivors level up on a variety skills. Rather than picking your path for you as in the original game, now you have the ability to carve out your survival scenario for yourself, but be careful what you wish for.
179804.name: Zpocalypse 2: Defend the Burbs

179805.name: Realmwalkers Light Edition
179805.description:
Publisher blurb:

Two factions -- Chaos and Order -- vie for control of the Cosmos. Agents of each faction engage in various levels of the struggle, from mundane encounters to massive campaigns.

Realmwalkers Light Edition is compatible with several other games from the same publisher.

179806.name: The Order of the Fifth World
179806.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Order of the Fifth World is a source book that describes one particular setting of the game Realmwalkers. The world described is only one of a continuum of places that characters may visit during a typical Realmwakers campaign, but it serves as a good base of operations for beginning players.

Includes map of variant USA.

179807.name: Realmwalkers Light Earth Conversion
179807.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Predicate of War, the document that defines the protocol by which the War must be fought, gives precise attention to Earth and sets rigid standards by which operations on Earth must be executed. Highlights of the Predicate are presented in this supplement.

179808.description:
If you have collected this promo egg, then, at the end of a round, you can turn any one exploding (red) egg you've collected into a good (blue) egg. The catch is this: If you collected this promo egg, but otherwise have all good eggs at the end of a round, you have to turn one of your good eggs into an exploding egg!

In either case, the number value of the egg stays the same but flip flops from positive to negative or vice versa (e.g., an exploding egg worth -10VP is now worth 10VP instead).

This promo card was available through supporting Unpub 5.
179808.name: Eggs and Empires: U-Turn Promo Card

179809.name: 100% Orange Juice
179809.description:
Story

This is a world where dogs, people and machines fly through the air.
In that world, a small patch of darkness was born.
Infinitesimal at first, it gradually began to envelop everything...

A youth named Kai, led by the mysterious life form known as Marie Poppo, begins a journey that will span worlds. The black, bottomless darkness of desire slowly eats away at both Kai and the world itself...


Features


Dice, cards, stars, battles and pudding
4 Single-player campaigns
Playable by up to 4 players
More than 50 different cards to collect
Countless battle combinations
Utilize each character's unique combat attributes
Use Hyper Cards to come back from behind


Source: The Publisher Website.

179810.description: Co słychać na farmie? ("What's Happening on the Farm?") is a fast game in which you roll a six-sided dice, then try to find the animal that appears that many times on a card. Whoever makes the correct animal sound gets the card. After the deck runs out, whoever has the most cards wins.
179810.name: Co słychać na farmie?
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

179811.name: The Last Word: Gilbert Harding's Party Game
179811.description:
Contents. 17 sheets, on each of which several 4-letter words are printed; one sheet on which the solutions are printed, and 12 answer cards.

The host keeps the solution sheet, and places the 17 sheets around the room separately so that each one can easily be seen. Each player is then given an answer card and a pencil. The players write their names at the head of their cards.
On line No. 1 on each answer card appears a 4-letter word, and on line 11 a different 4-letter word is printed. The players have to write in each of the 10 spaces (Nos. 2 to 10) on their answer cards a 4-letter word, each one different by one letter only from the word immediately before it, so that the tenth word has only one letter different from the word printed at the foot of their answer cards.

The words they require all appear on the 17 sheets distributed about the room; so, on the word “ Go! ” the players examine the sheets until they see on one of them a word different by one letter from the word at the top of their answer cards. They write this down on line No. 2 and then proceed to look for the next word, which will be one letter different again from what they have just written, and so on.

The winner is the player who first completes a correct answer card. He takes it to the host for checking.
N.B.—The words on the 17 sheets are not, of course, in correct order.

Note
Gilbert Harding (1907 - 1960) became a TV celebrity mainly thanks to his regular appearances on the BBC version of What's My Line? He was cantankerous and had volatile outbursts against contestants he found rather dull. This character trait made the show compulsive viewing in the 1950's.

179812.name: Leva Livets Stora Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory
179812.description: Leva Livets Stora Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory is a big box edition of Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory. This box contains of 82 characters (instead of 36) and 75 bingo cards (instead of 25). The game can be played in three levels, eg. sundayschool year 1-3, with 25 characters for each level. The game plays the same way as Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory.

179813.description: In Manhattan TraffIQ, two to four players compete on the streets of Manhattan for the most lucrative routes transporting people and goods. To do this, players place their trucks and taxis on a gradually growing city map. At the end of the game, they must have as many vehicles on the roads as possible...
179813.name: Manhattan TraffIQ
boardgameexpansion: Manhattan TraffIQ - Empire State Building expansion

boardgamecompilation: Agents of SMERSH:  Secret Mission Cards
Agents of SMERSH: Swagman's Hope Kickstarter Extras
Agents of SMERSH: The Director's Watchful Eye Promo Card
179814.description:
This box contains all the Kickstarter Promo items from the original Agents of SMERSH 2nd Edition campaign, including everything from the Agents of SMERSH: Kickstarter Extras, except for the extra white cubes, and everything from the Agents of SMERSH: Swagman's Hope Kickstarter Extras. This promo also includes an additional Henchman, “Vision.”


3 Henchman mats
The Shadow
The Gambler (plus token)
Vision (plus token)

6 UN Character mats
Zyler
Dust Flanders
Dread Tod
Mosé Calderón
Tilly Philips
Grant Massey

6 Character tokens
6 plastic standees
1 Poker chip
1 Custom Travel Die
1 “The Director's Watchful Eye” Promo Card
21 Secret Mission cards
Space Station Scenario and tokens
Instructions
179814.name: Agents of SMERSH: All the Kickstarter Promos

179815.description:
Hero Dice is a dice-based competitive role-playing game where every player is vying to become the most famous Hero around. Roll your character race, class and ability, and then set out exploring dungeons, fighting bandits, and showing up other Heroes.

At the start of you the game every player rolls to determine their Race, Class, and Ability. They will play a factor in battles against other players and enemies you encounter, providing advantages and disadvantages. As you roll other dice throughout the game, if you hit one of your 3 main die, it will automatically change to reflect the new die face up - only you can change your character.

During the game you'll be earning Fame and Infamy which can be spent to help you succeed at battles and gaining Companions. Though there's a lot of randomness to be had with dice, it involves a great deal of strategy and provides multiple ways to play and experience the game.

In a quest to become the most famous Hero around, how will you get there? Honor, deception, friendship, treachery...what kind of Hero will you become?
179815.name: Hero Dice

179816.description:
Poly-Y is an abstract strategy connection board game for two players. It is the successor of The Game of Y and the precursor of Star and *Star.

Players compete to capture the majority of corners of the board. A player captures a corner by making a Y with his pieces that connects the two sides adjacent to the corner with any other side of the board.

Poly-Y does not have a standard board. It can be played on any board that has the following characteristics:


An equal number of cells along each side
An odd number of sides; 5- and 9-sided boards are preferred
Tessellated by mostly six-sided cells


Description from Mudcrack Y & Poly-Y (1975) by Craige Schensted and Charles Titus and Connection Games (2005) by Cameron Browne.
179816.name: Poly-Y

179817.name: Placidhaven
179817.description:
Publisher blurb:

Placidhaven is a fantasy setting for use with a rules-light RPG game based on accumulating points through the use of dice pools. Characters have levels and points which influence their power and which actions are successful. The campaign setting is a traditional fantasy world named Placidhaven.

179818.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 165 - Nov 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Avengers Vs. X-Men Marvel Dice Masters
Bringing Cars and Planes to Life!
Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space RPG — The First Doctor Sourcebook
Have Scarf, Will Time Travel: Doctor Who Inspired Games From Cubicle 7
Star Trek Catan & Star Trek Federation Space
179818.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

179819.description:
A box set of four Zombicide: Black Plague survivors that were designed by Stefan Kopinski. The survivors include:

Azure
Miss Ysabel
Gaak
The Blackheart
179819.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Stefan Kopinski

179820.description:
Description from the publisher:

Villainous rats have allied with vicious hunting birds to pillage the humble mouse settlement across Meanderfield. But look! Brave mice, mounted on starlings and blue jays, swoop in to wage war against this evil alliance! The Downwood Militia soars into action against the Vermin Raiders!

Plaid Hat Games proudly presents Tail Feathers, the exciting new miniature skirmish game by our very own Jerry Hawthorne set in the beloved world of Mice and Mystics. Soar across the table, send your troops on dangerous missions, lock beaks with opposing birds, and defend your nest!

Featuring the beautiful hand-sculpted miniatures by Chad Hoverter Mice and Mystics fans have come to love, Tail Feathers raises the stakes with 13 dutiful ground troops, 5 headstrong birds that tilt for launching and turning, plus 5 daring pilots. Players will recreate the famous battles for aerial supremacy that shaped the Mice and Mystics world.

Outwit and outfly your opponent in stand-alone scenarios, or play a full campaign and see your units gain skill from one battle to the next.

Tail Feathers is a stand-alone game, not a Mice and Mystics expansion, but you can use your Mice and Mystics: Sorrow and Remembrance miniatures in Tail Feathers right out of the box.

Tail Feathers offers cinematic gameplay and a fresh, whimsical setting for tabletop skirmish gaming. Players must balance the use of both flying and ground units to achieve victory. Here are some highlights:


Compatibility! If you already own Mice and Mystics, you're in luck! Tail Feathers includes cards which allow you to use your Mice and Mystics figures in Tail Feathers! Bam!
Story driven campaign! Tail Feathers includes a scenario book with story rich scenarios all designed to be played either as both stand-alone experiences or linked together as a campaign.
Unique and challenging flight system! Tail Feathers includes 5 beautiful bird miniatures that are mounted on a special flight stand that allows the birds to 'tilt'. This tilting is a mechanism used to determine your flight direction, but the skill of effectively maneuvering your birds is up to you!
Everything you need! No empty box here. Tail Feathers comes with enough content for two players to field fully-realized, battle-ready forces, as well as cards that allow you to utilize your Mice and Mystics: Sorrow and Remembrance figures as Tail Feathers ground troops right away.


Tail Feathers expands the Mice and Mystics universe, introducing fans new and old to the battles on birds that secured peace and safety for the Downwood Forest. Tail Feathers' innovative game system will provide hours of fun and excitement in the world of Mice and Mystics.
179820.name: Tail Feathers
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 82 - GenCon Surprises!
Ep 021 – I, Geek Live at the DBS
Ep. 18 Tail Feathers With Jerry Hawthorne
Episode 13: Essen 2015 Wrapup - Worlds Fair Preview - BGG Con, Space Hulk and More!
Episode 23: Tail Feathers Review - Jamey Stegmaier Interview
Episode 64- Tail Feathers & 2016 Predictions/Resolutions
Tail Feathers Review

179821.name: Fantasy Compendium
179821.description:
Publisher blurb:

A supplement for use with Placidhaven RPG. This document includes numerous monsters for use during play, arranged alphabetically.

Does not include art.

Can also be utilized with other Mind's Eye Light system games.

179822.name: Hero 8
179822.description:
Publisher blurb:

Hero 8 is a simple dice-based game that focuses on narrative role play over statistics or mechanics. In Hero 8, the characters are superheroes with various abilities. These abilities primarily are narrative elements abstracted into a mechanic called "points" which are replenished through dice rolls.

179823.name: TekHL
179823.description:
Publisher blurb:

TekHL is intended to be a cyber-gothic horror setting utilizing the Mind's Eye Light RPG mechanic which favors narrative excitement over mechanics and rules. The setting presents the sprawling metropolis of TekHL (pronounced tech hell) where Cthulhoid monstrosities merge with cyberpunk systems. The characters are free to pursue their own goals which principally involves survival.

The game book is unusual in being partially written in a narrative, fictional style, from which the setting can be extrapolated.

179824.name: Magic
179824.description:
Publisher blurb:

Magic is intended to provide magic-using heroes in the Hero 8 RPG or to supplement various characters in the Placidhaven RPG. It is fundamentally compatible with most of the Mind's Eye RPG Light games.

After a brief introduction regarding the functioning of magic in the RPG, the remainder of the document is devoted to an alphabetized list of spells (i.e., magical effects) and their point cost.

179825.name: Magic Gear
179825.description:
Publisher blurb:

Magic Gear is a supplement for use with several of the Mind's Eye RPG Light system games. It provides basic rules on how to manufacture magical items for character use, and suggestions on how best to implement magical items in a typical campaign.

179826.name: Aliens
179826.description:
Publisher blurb:

Aliens is a supplement for the Hero 8 RPG and adds rules for alien characters and beings. The supplement has concise sections for physiology, natural abilities, sociological stance, and potential weaknesses. It also notes the typical longevity of a given type or species of alien.

179827.name: Cyber Heroes
179827.description:
From the introductory page:

Cyber heroes are always a favorite. They represent the hybrid of man and machine, the pinnacle of technology. Hero 8 allows you the option of playing one of many cyber-heroes in this supplement.

179828.name: Inner Mind
179828.description:
Inner Mind is a supplement for use with the Hero 8 RPG though it could also work with most of the RPG systems produced by Mind's Eye.

From the first page of the supplement:
Psychics play an important role in hero-styled games. This supplement contains not only psychic powers that characters may choose, but also different character templates for playing different kinds of psychic superheroes.

179829.name: Book of Talents
179829.description:
Book of Talents is a supplement for use with most of Mind's Eye RPG Light systems. The talents are listed alphabetically with a concise description of what the might permit within the game. Talents "cost" one to three points.

From the first page:

There are many different talents that a character may learn. Some are useful in combat, others are only useful for the role-playing aspects of the game. Any character may purchase any talent.

179830.name: Telling Your Story
179830.description:
Publisher blurb:

Telling Your Story is a supplement intended to assist the referee in running any role-playing game. The document offers general advice and specific hints for several Mind's Eye RPG Light system games.

179831.name: Legion of the Damned
179831.description:
Publisher blurb:
